cobblemon.move.tackle.desc: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.
cobblemon.move.aerialace.desc: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.aurasphere.desc: The user lets loose a blast of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.airslash.desc: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.species.bulbasaur.name: Bulbasaur
cobblemon.species.bulbasaur.desc1: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.
cobblemon.species.bulbasaur.desc2: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.
cobblemon.species.charmander.name: Charmander
cobblemon.species.charmander.desc1: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
cobblemon.species.charmander.desc2: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.
cobblemon.species.squirtle.name: Squirtle
cobblemon.species.squirtle.desc1: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
cobblemon.species.squirtle.desc2: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
cobblemon.species.caterpie.name: Caterpie
cobblemon.species.caterpie.desc1: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
cobblemon.species.caterpie.desc2: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
cobblemon.species.weedle.name: Weedle
cobblemon.species.weedle.desc1: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
cobblemon.species.pidgey.name: Pidgey
cobblemon.species.pidgey.desc1: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
cobblemon.species.rattata.name: Rattata
cobblemon.species.rattata.desc1: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
cobblemon.species.spearow.name: Spearow
cobblemon.species.spearow.desc1: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
cobblemon.species.ekans.name: Ekans
cobblemon.species.ekans.desc1: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
cobblemon.species.sandshrew.name: Sandshrew
cobblemon.species.sandshrew.desc1: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.
cobblemon.species.sandshrew.desc2: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.
cobblemon.species.nidoranf.name: Nidoran♀
cobblemon.species.nidoranf.desc1: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.
cobblemon.species.nidoranf.desc2: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.
cobblemon.species.nidoranm.name: Nidoran♂
cobblemon.species.nidoranm.desc1: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.
cobblemon.species.nidoranm.desc2: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.
cobblemon.species.vulpix.name: Vulpix
cobblemon.species.vulpix.desc1: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
cobblemon.species.vulpix.desc2: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.
cobblemon.species.zubat.name: Zubat
cobblemon.species.zubat.desc1: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.
cobblemon.species.zubat.desc2: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.
cobblemon.species.oddish.name: Oddish
cobblemon.species.oddish.desc1: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
cobblemon.species.oddish.desc2: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
cobblemon.species.paras.name: Paras
cobblemon.species.paras.desc1: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
cobblemon.species.venonat.name: Venonat
cobblemon.species.venonat.desc1: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
cobblemon.species.diglett.name: Diglett
cobblemon.species.diglett.desc1: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
cobblemon.species.diglett.desc2: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.
cobblemon.species.meowth.name: Meowth
cobblemon.species.meowth.desc1: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.
cobblemon.species.meowth.desc2: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.
cobblemon.species.psyduck.name: Psyduck
cobblemon.species.psyduck.desc1: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
cobblemon.species.psyduck.desc2: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.
cobblemon.species.mankey.name: Mankey
cobblemon.species.mankey.desc1: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
cobblemon.species.growlithe.name: Growlithe
cobblemon.species.growlithe.desc1: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
cobblemon.species.growlithe.desc2: Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.
cobblemon.species.poliwag.name: Poliwag
cobblemon.species.poliwag.desc1: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
cobblemon.species.poliwag.desc2: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.
cobblemon.species.abra.name: Abra
cobblemon.species.abra.desc1: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
cobblemon.species.abra.desc2: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.
cobblemon.species.machop.name: Machop
cobblemon.species.machop.desc1: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
cobblemon.species.machop.desc2: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
cobblemon.species.bellsprout.name: Bellsprout
cobblemon.species.bellsprout.desc1: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
cobblemon.species.tentacool.name: Tentacool
cobblemon.species.tentacool.desc1: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
cobblemon.species.tentacool.desc2: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.
cobblemon.species.geodude.name: Geodude
cobblemon.species.geodude.desc1: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
cobblemon.species.ponyta.name: Ponyta
cobblemon.species.ponyta.desc1: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.
cobblemon.species.ponyta.desc2: If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.
cobblemon.species.slowpoke.name: Slowpoke
cobblemon.species.slowpoke.desc1: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.
cobblemon.species.slowpoke.desc2: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.magnemite.name: Magnemite
cobblemon.species.magnemite.desc1: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.
cobblemon.species.magnemite.desc2: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.
cobblemon.species.farfetchd.name: Farfetch’d
cobblemon.species.farfetchd.desc1: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
cobblemon.species.farfetchd.desc2: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.
cobblemon.species.doduo.name: Doduo
cobblemon.species.doduo.desc1: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
cobblemon.species.seel.name: Seel
cobblemon.species.seel.desc1: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.grimer.name: Grimer
cobblemon.species.grimer.desc1: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.
cobblemon.species.shellder.name: Shellder
cobblemon.species.shellder.desc1: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
cobblemon.species.shellder.desc2: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
cobblemon.species.gastly.name: Gastly
cobblemon.species.gastly.desc1: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
cobblemon.species.gastly.desc2: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
cobblemon.species.onix.name: Onix
cobblemon.species.onix.desc1: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
cobblemon.species.onix.desc2: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
cobblemon.species.drowzee.name: Drowzee
cobblemon.species.drowzee.desc1: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
cobblemon.species.krabby.name: Krabby
cobblemon.species.krabby.desc1: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
cobblemon.species.krabby.desc2: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
cobblemon.species.voltorb.name: Voltorb
cobblemon.species.voltorb.desc1: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
cobblemon.species.exeggcute.name: Exeggcute
cobblemon.species.exeggcute.desc1: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
cobblemon.species.exeggcute.desc2: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.
cobblemon.species.cubone.name: Cubone
cobblemon.species.cubone.desc1: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
cobblemon.species.cubone.desc2: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.
cobblemon.species.lickitung.name: Lickitung
cobblemon.species.lickitung.desc1: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.
cobblemon.species.lickitung.desc2: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.
cobblemon.species.koffing.name: Koffing
cobblemon.species.koffing.desc1: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
cobblemon.species.koffing.desc2: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
cobblemon.species.rhyhorn.name: Rhyhorn
cobblemon.species.rhyhorn.desc1: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
cobblemon.species.rhyhorn.desc2: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.
cobblemon.species.tangela.name: Tangela
cobblemon.species.tangela.desc1: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
cobblemon.species.tangela.desc2: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.
cobblemon.species.kangaskhan.name: Kangaskhan
cobblemon.species.kangaskhan.desc1: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
cobblemon.species.kangaskhan.desc2: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.
cobblemon.species.horsea.name: Horsea
cobblemon.species.horsea.desc1: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
cobblemon.species.horsea.desc2: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.
cobblemon.species.goldeen.name: Goldeen
cobblemon.species.goldeen.desc1: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
cobblemon.species.goldeen.desc2: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
cobblemon.species.staryu.name: Staryu
cobblemon.species.staryu.desc1: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
cobblemon.species.staryu.desc2: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.
cobblemon.species.scyther.name: Scyther
cobblemon.species.scyther.desc1: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
cobblemon.species.scyther.desc2: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you’ve found is a Scyther’s territory.
cobblemon.species.pinsir.name: Pinsir
cobblemon.species.pinsir.desc1: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
cobblemon.species.pinsir.desc2: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.
cobblemon.species.tauros.name: Tauros
cobblemon.species.tauros.desc1: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.
cobblemon.species.tauros.desc2: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.
cobblemon.species.magikarp.name: Magikarp
cobblemon.species.magikarp.desc1: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
cobblemon.species.magikarp.desc2: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.
cobblemon.species.lapras.name: Lapras
cobblemon.species.lapras.desc1: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
cobblemon.species.lapras.desc2: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.
cobblemon.species.ditto.name: Ditto
cobblemon.species.ditto.desc1: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
cobblemon.species.ditto.desc2: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.
cobblemon.species.eevee.name: Eevee
cobblemon.species.eevee.desc1: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.
cobblemon.species.eevee.desc2: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.
cobblemon.species.porygon.name: Porygon
cobblemon.species.porygon.desc1: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.
cobblemon.species.porygon.desc2: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.
cobblemon.species.omanyte.name: Omanyte
cobblemon.species.omanyte.desc1: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
cobblemon.species.omanyte.desc2: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.
cobblemon.species.kabuto.name: Kabuto
cobblemon.species.kabuto.desc1: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.
cobblemon.species.kabuto.desc2: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.
cobblemon.species.aerodactyl.name: Aerodactyl
cobblemon.species.aerodactyl.desc1: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.
cobblemon.species.aerodactyl.desc2: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.articuno.name: Articuno
cobblemon.species.articuno.desc1: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.
cobblemon.species.articuno.desc2: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.
cobblemon.species.zapdos.name: Zapdos
cobblemon.species.zapdos.desc1: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
cobblemon.species.zapdos.desc2: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.
cobblemon.species.moltres.name: Moltres
cobblemon.species.moltres.desc1: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.
cobblemon.species.moltres.desc2: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.
cobblemon.species.dratini.name: Dratini
cobblemon.species.dratini.desc1: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
cobblemon.species.dratini.desc2: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.
cobblemon.species.mewtwo.name: Mewtwo
cobblemon.species.mewtwo.desc1: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
cobblemon.species.mew.name: Mew
cobblemon.species.mew.desc1: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
cobblemon.species.chikorita.name: Chikorita
cobblemon.species.chikorita.desc1: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.
cobblemon.species.chikorita.desc2: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.
cobblemon.species.cyndaquil.name: Cyndaquil
cobblemon.species.cyndaquil.desc1: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
cobblemon.species.totodile.name: Totodile
cobblemon.species.totodile.desc1: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
cobblemon.species.sentret.name: Sentret
cobblemon.species.sentret.desc1: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
cobblemon.species.sentret.desc2: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
cobblemon.species.hoothoot.name: Hoothoot
cobblemon.species.hoothoot.desc1: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
cobblemon.species.hoothoot.desc2: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.
cobblemon.species.ledyba.name: Ledyba
cobblemon.species.ledyba.desc1: This Pokémon is very sensitive to cold. In the warmth of Alola, it appears quite lively.
cobblemon.species.ledyba.desc2: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.
cobblemon.species.spinarak.name: Spinarak
cobblemon.species.spinarak.desc1: With threads from its mouth, it fashions sturdy webs that won’t break even if you set a rock on them.
cobblemon.species.spinarak.desc2: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.
cobblemon.species.chinchou.name: Chinchou
cobblemon.species.chinchou.desc1: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.
cobblemon.species.chinchou.desc2: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.
cobblemon.species.pichu.name: Pichu
cobblemon.species.pichu.desc1: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.
cobblemon.species.pichu.desc2: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.
cobblemon.species.cleffa.name: Cleffa
cobblemon.species.cleffa.desc1: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.
cobblemon.species.cleffa.desc2: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
cobblemon.species.igglybuff.name: Igglybuff
cobblemon.species.igglybuff.desc1: Igglybuff loves to sing. Its marshmallow-like body gives off a faint sweet smell.
cobblemon.species.igglybuff.desc2: Taking advantage of the softness of its body, Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a deep pink when its temperature rises.
cobblemon.species.togepi.name: Togepi
cobblemon.species.togepi.desc1: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
cobblemon.species.togepi.desc2: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.
cobblemon.species.natu.name: Natu
cobblemon.species.natu.desc1: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.
cobblemon.species.natu.desc2: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
cobblemon.species.mareep.name: Mareep
cobblemon.species.mareep.desc1: Clothing made from Mareep’s fleece is easily charged with static electricity, so a special process is used on it.
cobblemon.species.mareep.desc2: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.
cobblemon.species.hoppip.name: Hoppip
cobblemon.species.hoppip.desc1: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.
cobblemon.species.aipom.name: Aipom
cobblemon.species.aipom.desc1: As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.
cobblemon.species.aipom.desc2: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.
cobblemon.species.sunkern.name: Sunkern
cobblemon.species.sunkern.desc1: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
cobblemon.species.yanma.name: Yanma
cobblemon.species.yanma.desc1: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
cobblemon.species.yanma.desc2: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
cobblemon.species.wooper.name: Wooper
cobblemon.species.wooper.desc1: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
cobblemon.species.wooper.desc2: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.
cobblemon.species.murkrow.name: Murkrow
cobblemon.species.murkrow.desc1: It has a weakness for shiny things. It’s been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.
cobblemon.species.murkrow.desc2: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow’s presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.
cobblemon.species.misdreavus.name: Misdreavus
cobblemon.species.misdreavus.desc1: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.
cobblemon.species.misdreavus.desc2: What makes it happy is imitating the voices of weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn’t deal well with folks who aren’t easily frightened.
cobblemon.species.unown.name: Unown
cobblemon.species.unown.desc1: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
cobblemon.species.girafarig.name: Girafarig
cobblemon.species.girafarig.desc1: Girafarig’s rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this Pokémon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.
cobblemon.species.girafarig.desc2: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
cobblemon.species.pineco.name: Pineco
cobblemon.species.pineco.desc1: Motionless, it hangs from trees, waiting for its bug Pokémon prey to come to it. Its favorite in Alola is Cutiefly.
cobblemon.species.pineco.desc2: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.
cobblemon.species.dunsparce.name: Dunsparce
cobblemon.species.dunsparce.desc1: This Pokémon’s tiny wings have some scientists saying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky in ancient times.
cobblemon.species.dunsparce.desc2: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.
cobblemon.species.gligar.name: Gligar
cobblemon.species.gligar.desc1: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.
cobblemon.species.snubbull.name: Snubbull
cobblemon.species.snubbull.desc1: It grows close to others easily and is also easily spoiled. The disparity between its face and its actions makes many young people wild about it.
cobblemon.species.snubbull.desc2: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.
cobblemon.species.qwilfish.name: Qwilfish
cobblemon.species.qwilfish.desc1: When faced with a larger opponent, it swallows as much water as it can to match the opponent’s size.
cobblemon.species.qwilfish.desc2: The small spikes covering its body developed from scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.
cobblemon.species.shuckle.name: Shuckle
cobblemon.species.shuckle.desc1: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
cobblemon.species.shuckle.desc2: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.
cobblemon.species.heracross.name: Heracross
cobblemon.species.heracross.desc1: Heracross loves sweet sap and will go looking through forests for it. The Pokémon uses its two antennae to pick up scents as it searches.
cobblemon.species.heracross.desc2: This Pokémon takes pride in its strength, which allows it to lift things 100 times heavier than itself with no trouble at all.
cobblemon.species.sneasel.name: Sneasel
cobblemon.species.sneasel.desc1: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.
cobblemon.species.sneasel.desc2: It has a cunning yet savage disposition. It waits for parents to leave their nests, and then it sneaks in to steal their eggs.
cobblemon.species.teddiursa.name: Teddiursa
cobblemon.species.teddiursa.desc1: This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.
cobblemon.species.slugma.name: Slugma
cobblemon.species.slugma.desc1: Molten magma courses throughout Slugma’s circulatory system. If this Pokémon is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.
cobblemon.species.slugma.desc2: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
cobblemon.species.swinub.name: Swinub
cobblemon.species.swinub.desc1: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.
cobblemon.species.swinub.desc2: If it smells something enticing, it dashes off headlong to find the source of the aroma.
cobblemon.species.corsola.name: Corsola
cobblemon.species.corsola.desc1: It will regrow any branches that break off its head. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola branches as charms to promote safe childbirth.
cobblemon.species.corsola.desc2: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.
cobblemon.species.remoraid.name: Remoraid
cobblemon.species.remoraid.desc1: The water they shoot from their mouths can hit moving prey from more than 300 feet away.
cobblemon.species.remoraid.desc2: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine’s underside to scavenge for leftovers.
cobblemon.species.delibird.name: Delibird
cobblemon.species.delibird.desc1: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
cobblemon.species.delibird.desc2: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging around for more food.
cobblemon.species.skarmory.name: Skarmory
cobblemon.species.skarmory.desc1: The pointed feathers of these Pokémon are sharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight fight viciously over territory.
cobblemon.species.skarmory.desc2: People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.
cobblemon.species.houndour.name: Houndour
cobblemon.species.houndour.desc1: It cooperates with others skillfully. When it becomes your partner, it’s very loyal to you as its Trainer and will obey your orders.
cobblemon.species.houndour.desc2: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.
cobblemon.species.phanpy.name: Phanpy
cobblemon.species.phanpy.desc1: For its nest, Phanpy digs a vertical pit in the ground at the edge of a river. It marks the area around its nest with its trunk to let the others know that the area has been claimed.
cobblemon.species.phanpy.desc2: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.
cobblemon.species.stantler.name: Stantler
cobblemon.species.stantler.desc1: Stantler’s magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.
cobblemon.species.smeargle.name: Smeargle
cobblemon.species.smeargle.desc1: The fluid of Smeargle’s tail secretions changes in the intensity of its hue as the Pokémon’s emotions change.
cobblemon.species.smeargle.desc2: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.
cobblemon.species.tyrogue.name: Tyrogue
cobblemon.species.tyrogue.desc1: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.
cobblemon.species.tyrogue.desc2: Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.
cobblemon.species.smoochum.name: Smoochum
cobblemon.species.smoochum.desc1: If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty, Smoochum doesn’t really seem to care.
cobblemon.species.smoochum.desc2: This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum decides what it likes and dislikes by touching things with its lips.
cobblemon.species.elekid.name: Elekid
cobblemon.species.elekid.desc1: When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder, it gets full-on rowdy.
cobblemon.species.elekid.desc2: It’s not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémon sneaks into people’s homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.
cobblemon.species.magby.name: Magby
cobblemon.species.magby.desc1: This Pokémon is still small and timid. Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised, flames leak from its mouth and its nose.
cobblemon.species.magby.desc2: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.
cobblemon.species.miltank.name: Miltank
cobblemon.species.miltank.desc1: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it’s been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.
cobblemon.species.miltank.desc2: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.
cobblemon.species.raikou.name: Raikou
cobblemon.species.raikou.desc1: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
cobblemon.species.raikou.desc2: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
cobblemon.species.entei.name: Entei
cobblemon.species.entei.desc1: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
cobblemon.species.entei.desc2: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
cobblemon.species.suicune.name: Suicune
cobblemon.species.suicune.desc1: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.
cobblemon.species.larvitar.name: Larvitar
cobblemon.species.larvitar.desc1: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.
cobblemon.species.larvitar.desc2: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
cobblemon.species.lugia.name: Lugia
cobblemon.species.lugia.desc1: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
cobblemon.species.hooh.name: Ho-Oh
cobblemon.species.hooh.desc1: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.
cobblemon.species.celebi.name: Celebi
cobblemon.species.celebi.desc1: This Pokémon has the ability to move through time. Records describing it as a forest deity can be found from many different eras.
cobblemon.species.celebi.desc2: This Pokémon traveled through time to come from the future. It bolsters grass and trees with its own strength, and it can heal wounds, too.
cobblemon.species.treecko.name: Treecko
cobblemon.species.treecko.desc1: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokémon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.
cobblemon.species.treecko.desc2: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.
cobblemon.species.torchic.name: Torchic
cobblemon.species.torchic.desc1: Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with unsteady steps. This Pokémon breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.
cobblemon.species.torchic.desc2: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
cobblemon.species.mudkip.name: Mudkip
cobblemon.species.mudkip.desc1: The fin on Mudkip’s head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this Pokémon can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.
cobblemon.species.mudkip.desc2: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
cobblemon.species.poochyena.name: Poochyena
cobblemon.species.poochyena.desc1: At first sight, Poochyena takes a bite at anything that moves. This Pokémon chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.
cobblemon.species.poochyena.desc2: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.
cobblemon.species.zigzagoon.name: Zigzagoon
cobblemon.species.zigzagoon.desc1: It marks its territory by rubbing its bristly fur on trees. This variety of Zigzagoon is friendlier and calmer than the kind native to Galar.
cobblemon.species.zigzagoon.desc2: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.
cobblemon.species.wurmple.name: Wurmple
cobblemon.species.wurmple.desc1: Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokémon’s feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.
cobblemon.species.wurmple.desc2: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.
cobblemon.species.lotad.name: Lotad
cobblemon.species.lotad.desc1: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
cobblemon.species.lotad.desc2: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.
cobblemon.species.seedot.name: Seedot
cobblemon.species.seedot.desc1: If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.seedot.desc2: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
cobblemon.species.taillow.name: Taillow
cobblemon.species.taillow.desc1: Taillow courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy Pokémon will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
cobblemon.species.taillow.desc2: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
cobblemon.species.wingull.name: Wingull
cobblemon.species.wingull.desc1: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.
cobblemon.species.wingull.desc2: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.
cobblemon.species.ralts.name: Ralts
cobblemon.species.ralts.desc1: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
cobblemon.species.ralts.desc2: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
cobblemon.species.surskit.name: Surskit
cobblemon.species.surskit.desc1: If it’s in a pinch, it will secrete a sweet liquid from the tip of its head. Syrup made from gathering that liquid is tasty on bread.
cobblemon.species.surskit.desc2: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.
cobblemon.species.shroomish.name: Shroomish
cobblemon.species.shroomish.desc1: Shroomish live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This Pokémon feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.
cobblemon.species.shroomish.desc2: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.
cobblemon.species.slakoth.name: Slakoth
cobblemon.species.slakoth.desc1: Slakoth lolls around for over 20 hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This Pokémon’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.
cobblemon.species.slakoth.desc2: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.
cobblemon.species.nincada.name: Nincada
cobblemon.species.nincada.desc1: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
cobblemon.species.nincada.desc2: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
cobblemon.species.whismur.name: Whismur
cobblemon.species.whismur.desc1: The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels. If you’re close to a Whismur when it lets out a cry, you’ll be stuck with an all-day headache.
cobblemon.species.whismur.desc2: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.
cobblemon.species.makuhita.name: Makuhita
cobblemon.species.makuhita.desc1: It practices its slaps by repeatedly slapping tree trunks. It has been known to slap an Exeggutor and get flung away.
cobblemon.species.makuhita.desc2: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.
cobblemon.species.azurill.name: Azurill
cobblemon.species.azurill.desc1: The ball on Azurill’s tail bounces like a rubber ball, and it’s full of the nutrients the Pokémon needs to grow.
cobblemon.species.azurill.desc2: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.
cobblemon.species.nosepass.name: Nosepass
cobblemon.species.nosepass.desc1: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it’s in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.
cobblemon.species.nosepass.desc2: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.
cobblemon.species.skitty.name: Skitty
cobblemon.species.skitty.desc1: Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This Pokémon is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
cobblemon.species.skitty.desc2: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
cobblemon.species.sableye.name: Sableye
cobblemon.species.sableye.desc1: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it’s believed that Sableye will steal people’s spirits away.
cobblemon.species.sableye.desc2: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.
cobblemon.species.mawile.name: Mawile
cobblemon.species.mawile.desc1: It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into complacency, then bites with its huge, relentless jaws.
cobblemon.species.mawile.desc2: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.
cobblemon.species.aron.name: Aron
cobblemon.species.aron.desc1: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks— to build up the steel armor that protects its body.
cobblemon.species.aron.desc2: When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In ancient times, people would collect Aron’s shed armor and make good use of it in their daily lives.
cobblemon.species.meditite.name: Meditite
cobblemon.species.meditite.desc1: Meditite undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this Pokémon always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.
cobblemon.species.meditite.desc2: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.
cobblemon.species.electrike.name: Electrike
cobblemon.species.electrike.desc1: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
cobblemon.species.electrike.desc2: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.
cobblemon.species.plusle.name: Plusle
cobblemon.species.plusle.desc1: Plusle always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this Pokémon shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.
cobblemon.species.plusle.desc2: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.
cobblemon.species.minun.name: Minun
cobblemon.species.minun.desc1: Minun is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
cobblemon.species.minun.desc2: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
cobblemon.species.volbeat.name: Volbeat
cobblemon.species.volbeat.desc1: With the arrival of night, Volbeat emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This Pokémon is attracted by the sweet aroma of Illumise.
cobblemon.species.volbeat.desc2: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
cobblemon.species.illumise.name: Illumise
cobblemon.species.illumise.desc1: Illumise attracts a swarm of Volbeat using a sweet fragrance. Once the Volbeat have gathered, this Pokémon leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.
cobblemon.species.illumise.desc2: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
cobblemon.species.gulpin.name: Gulpin
cobblemon.species.gulpin.desc1: Virtually all of Gulpin’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This Pokémon’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.
cobblemon.species.gulpin.desc2: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.
cobblemon.species.carvanha.name: Carvanha
cobblemon.species.carvanha.desc1: It won’t attack while it’s alone—not even if it spots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to join it, and then the Pokémon attack as a group.
cobblemon.species.carvanha.desc2: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.
cobblemon.species.wailmer.name: Wailmer
cobblemon.species.wailmer.desc1: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
cobblemon.species.wailmer.desc2: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.
cobblemon.species.numel.name: Numel
cobblemon.species.numel.desc1: Numel is extremely dull witted—it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This Pokémon’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.
cobblemon.species.numel.desc2: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.
cobblemon.species.torkoal.name: Torkoal
cobblemon.species.torkoal.desc1: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
cobblemon.species.torkoal.desc2: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
cobblemon.species.spoink.name: Spoink
cobblemon.species.spoink.desc1: Spoink bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this Pokémon cannot afford to stop bouncing—if it stops, its heart will stop.
cobblemon.species.spoink.desc2: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
cobblemon.species.spinda.name: Spinda
cobblemon.species.spinda.desc1: Its steps are shaky and stumbling. Walking for a long time makes it feel sick.
cobblemon.species.spinda.desc2: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!
cobblemon.species.trapinch.name: Trapinch
cobblemon.species.trapinch.desc1: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.
cobblemon.species.trapinch.desc2: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
cobblemon.species.cacnea.name: Cacnea
cobblemon.species.cacnea.desc1: Cacnea lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this Pokémon shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
cobblemon.species.cacnea.desc2: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.
cobblemon.species.swablu.name: Swablu
cobblemon.species.swablu.desc1: Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light and fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care of its wings.
cobblemon.species.swablu.desc2: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.
cobblemon.species.zangoose.name: Zangoose
cobblemon.species.zangoose.desc1: Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every cell of Zangoose’s body. This Pokémon adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.
cobblemon.species.zangoose.desc2: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
cobblemon.species.seviper.name: Seviper
cobblemon.species.seviper.desc1: Seviper shares a generations-long feud with Zangoose. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This Pokémon attacks using its sword-edged tail.
cobblemon.species.seviper.desc2: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
cobblemon.species.lunatone.name: Lunatone
cobblemon.species.lunatone.desc1: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It’s active on the night of a full moon.
cobblemon.species.lunatone.desc2: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
cobblemon.species.solrock.name: Solrock
cobblemon.species.solrock.desc1: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.
cobblemon.species.solrock.desc2: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.
cobblemon.species.barboach.name: Barboach
cobblemon.species.barboach.desc1: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.
cobblemon.species.barboach.desc2: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
cobblemon.species.corphish.name: Corphish
cobblemon.species.corphish.desc1: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.
cobblemon.species.corphish.desc2: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.
cobblemon.species.baltoy.name: Baltoy
cobblemon.species.baltoy.desc1: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.
cobblemon.species.baltoy.desc2: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.
cobblemon.species.lileep.name: Lileep
cobblemon.species.lileep.desc1: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Lileep once lived in warm seas that existed approximately 100,000,000 years ago.
cobblemon.species.lileep.desc2: Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with petallike tentacles.
cobblemon.species.anorith.name: Anorith
cobblemon.species.anorith.desc1: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Anorith lived in the ocean about 100,000,000 years ago, hunting with its pair of claws.
cobblemon.species.anorith.desc2: Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings through the water like oars on a boat. This Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.feebas.name: Feebas
cobblemon.species.feebas.desc1: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokémon’s marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.
cobblemon.species.feebas.desc2: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.
cobblemon.species.castform.name: Castform
cobblemon.species.castform.desc1: Although its form changes with the weather, that is apparently the result of a chemical reaction and not the result of its own free will.
cobblemon.species.castform.desc2: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!
cobblemon.species.kecleon.name: Kecleon
cobblemon.species.kecleon.desc1: It changes its hue to blend into its surroundings. If no one takes notice of it for too long, it will pout and never reveal itself.
cobblemon.species.kecleon.desc2: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.
cobblemon.species.shuppet.name: Shuppet
cobblemon.species.shuppet.desc1: It eats up emotions like malice, jealousy, and resentment, so some people are grateful for its presence.
cobblemon.species.shuppet.desc2: There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”
cobblemon.species.duskull.name: Duskull
cobblemon.species.duskull.desc1: If it finds bad children who won’t listen to their parents, it will spirit them away—or so it’s said.
cobblemon.species.duskull.desc2: Making itself invisible, it silently sneaks up to prey. It has the ability to slip through thick walls.
cobblemon.species.tropius.name: Tropius
cobblemon.species.tropius.desc1: The bunches of fruit growing around the necks of Tropius in Alola are especially sweet compared to those in other regions.
cobblemon.species.tropius.desc2: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.
cobblemon.species.absol.name: Absol
cobblemon.species.absol.desc1: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.
cobblemon.species.absol.desc2: Because of this Pokémon’s ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.
cobblemon.species.wynaut.name: Wynaut
cobblemon.species.wynaut.desc1: It tends to move in a pack. Individuals squash against one another to toughen their spirits.
cobblemon.species.wynaut.desc2: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.
cobblemon.species.snorunt.name: Snorunt
cobblemon.species.snorunt.desc1: It’s said that if they are seen at midnight, they’ll cause heavy snow. They eat snow and ice to survive.
cobblemon.species.snorunt.desc2: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as −150 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.spheal.name: Spheal
cobblemon.species.spheal.desc1: This Pokémon’s body is covered in blubber and impressively round. It’s faster for Spheal to roll around than walk.
cobblemon.species.spheal.desc2: As it drifts among the waves, Spheal probes the sea. As soon as it spots prey, it informs the Walrein in its herd.
cobblemon.species.clamperl.name: Clamperl
cobblemon.species.clamperl.desc1: Despite its appearance, it’s carnivorous. It clamps down on its prey with both sides of its shell and doesn’t let go until they stop moving.
cobblemon.species.clamperl.desc2: Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder’s pearls.
cobblemon.species.relicanth.name: Relicanth
cobblemon.species.relicanth.desc1: Rock-hard scales and oil-filled swim bladders allow this Pokémon to survive the intense water pressure of the deep sea.
cobblemon.species.relicanth.desc2: This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea exploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in 100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.
cobblemon.species.luvdisc.name: Luvdisc
cobblemon.species.luvdisc.desc1: There was an era when it was overfished due to the rumor that having one of its heart-shaped scales would enable you to find a sweetheart.
cobblemon.species.luvdisc.desc2: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.
cobblemon.species.bagon.name: Bagon
cobblemon.species.bagon.desc1: Bagon jumps off cliffs every day, trying to grow stronger so that someday it will be able to fly.
cobblemon.species.bagon.desc2: Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form groups with others of its kind. It also has a head hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.
cobblemon.species.beldum.name: Beldum
cobblemon.species.beldum.desc1: From its rear, Beldum emits a magnetic force that rapidly pulls opponents in. They get skewered on Beldum’s sharp claws.
cobblemon.species.beldum.desc2: The cells in this Pokémon’s body are composed of magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic forces flow through Beldum’s body.
cobblemon.species.regirock.name: Regirock
cobblemon.species.regirock.desc1: Every bit of Regirock’s body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks rocks to itself to repair what’s been lost.
cobblemon.species.regirock.desc2: Cutting-edge technology was used to study the internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.
cobblemon.species.regice.name: Regice
cobblemon.species.regice.desc1: With cold air that can reach temperatures as low as −328 degrees Fahrenheit, Regice instantly freezes any creature that approaches it.
cobblemon.species.regice.desc2: This Pokémon’s body is made of solid ice. It’s said that Regice was born beneath thick ice in the ice age.
cobblemon.species.registeel.name: Registeel
cobblemon.species.registeel.desc1: Registeel’s body is made of a strange material that is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but also more durable than any metal.
cobblemon.species.registeel.desc2: It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep underground in the planet’s mantle and that it emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.
cobblemon.species.latias.name: Latias
cobblemon.species.latias.desc1: Latias is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this Pokémon ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.
cobblemon.species.latias.desc2: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
cobblemon.species.latios.name: Latios
cobblemon.species.latios.desc1: Latios has the ability to make others see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This Pokémon is intelligent and understands human speech.
cobblemon.species.latios.desc2: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
cobblemon.species.kyogre.name: Kyogre
cobblemon.species.kyogre.desc1: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.
cobblemon.species.kyogre.desc2: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
cobblemon.species.groudon.name: Groudon
cobblemon.species.groudon.desc1: Groudon is said to be the personification of the land itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Kyogre, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
cobblemon.species.groudon.desc2: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
cobblemon.species.rayquaza.name: Rayquaza
cobblemon.species.rayquaza.desc1: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.
cobblemon.species.rayquaza.desc2: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
cobblemon.species.jirachi.name: Jirachi
cobblemon.species.jirachi.desc1: Once every 1,000 years, the singing of a pure voice will rouse this Pokémon from its near- perpetual slumber. It wakes for only seven days.
cobblemon.species.jirachi.desc2: It’s believed that when this Pokémon wakes from its 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes written on the notes attached to its head.
cobblemon.species.deoxys.name: Deoxys
cobblemon.species.deoxys.desc1: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in Deoxys. The crystalline organ on this Pokémon’s chest appears to be its brain.
cobblemon.species.deoxys.desc2: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.
cobblemon.species.turtwig.name: Turtwig
cobblemon.species.turtwig.desc1: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
cobblemon.species.turtwig.desc2: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
cobblemon.species.chimchar.name: Chimchar
cobblemon.species.chimchar.desc1: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.
cobblemon.species.chimchar.desc2: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
cobblemon.species.piplup.name: Piplup
cobblemon.species.piplup.desc1: It doesn’t like to be taken care of. It’s difficult to bond with since it won’t listen to its Trainer.
cobblemon.species.piplup.desc2: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
cobblemon.species.starly.name: Starly
cobblemon.species.starly.desc1: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
cobblemon.species.starly.desc2: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
cobblemon.species.bidoof.name: Bidoof
cobblemon.species.bidoof.desc1: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
cobblemon.species.bidoof.desc2: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
cobblemon.species.kricketot.name: Kricketot
cobblemon.species.kricketot.desc1: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
cobblemon.species.kricketot.desc2: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
cobblemon.species.shinx.name: Shinx
cobblemon.species.shinx.desc1: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.
cobblemon.species.shinx.desc2: Electricity makes this Pokémon’s fur glow. Shinx sends signals to others of its kind by shaking the tip of its tail while the tail tip is shining brightly.
cobblemon.species.budew.name: Budew
cobblemon.species.budew.desc1: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s toxicity is increased.
cobblemon.species.budew.desc2: This Pokémon is highly sensitive to temperature changes. When its bud starts to open, that means spring is right around the corner.
cobblemon.species.cranidos.name: Cranidos
cobblemon.species.cranidos.desc1: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
cobblemon.species.cranidos.desc2: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.
cobblemon.species.shieldon.name: Shieldon
cobblemon.species.shieldon.desc1: A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.
cobblemon.species.shieldon.desc2: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.
cobblemon.species.burmy.name: Burmy
cobblemon.species.burmy.desc1: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
cobblemon.species.burmy.desc2: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
cobblemon.species.combee.name: Combee
cobblemon.species.combee.desc1: The members of the trio spend all their time together. Each one has a slightly different taste in nectar.
cobblemon.species.combee.desc2: It ceaselessly gathers nectar from sunrise to sundown, all for the sake of Vespiquen and the swarm.
cobblemon.species.pachirisu.name: Pachirisu
cobblemon.species.pachirisu.desc1: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
cobblemon.species.pachirisu.desc2: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
cobblemon.species.buizel.name: Buizel
cobblemon.species.buizel.desc1: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
cobblemon.species.buizel.desc2: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
cobblemon.species.cherubi.name: Cherubi
cobblemon.species.cherubi.desc1: It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked by bird Pokémon that would love to make off with its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.
cobblemon.species.cherubi.desc2: The deeper a Cherubi’s red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!
cobblemon.species.shellos.name: Shellos
cobblemon.species.shellos.desc1: This Pokémon’s habitat shapes its physique. According to some theories, life in warm ocean waters causes this variation to develop.
cobblemon.species.shellos.desc2: Subjecting this Pokémon to a strong force causes it to secrete a strange purple fluid. Though harmless, the fluid is awfully sticky.
cobblemon.species.drifloon.name: Drifloon
cobblemon.species.drifloon.desc1: Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children. However, it often quickly runs away again when the children play too roughly with it.
cobblemon.species.drifloon.desc2: The gathering of many souls gave rise to this Pokémon. During humid seasons, they seem to appear in abundance.
cobblemon.species.buneary.name: Buneary
cobblemon.species.buneary.desc1: If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.
cobblemon.species.buneary.desc2: Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and then striking with the force created by unrolling them. This attack becomes stronger with training.
cobblemon.species.glameow.name: Glameow
cobblemon.species.glameow.desc1: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
cobblemon.species.glameow.desc2: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.
cobblemon.species.chingling.name: Chingling
cobblemon.species.chingling.desc1: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
cobblemon.species.chingling.desc2: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
cobblemon.species.stunky.name: Stunky
cobblemon.species.stunky.desc1: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.
cobblemon.species.stunky.desc2: If it lifts its tail and points its rear at you, beware. It’s about to spray you with a fluid stinky enough to make you faint.
cobblemon.species.bronzor.name: Bronzor
cobblemon.species.bronzor.desc1: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn’t come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.
cobblemon.species.bronzor.desc2: Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface reflect the truth, according to common lore. Be that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.
cobblemon.species.bonsly.name: Bonsly
cobblemon.species.bonsly.desc1: It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes. The sweat is a little salty, while the tears have a slight bitterness.
cobblemon.species.bonsly.desc2: This Pokémon lives in dry, rocky areas. As its green spheres dry out, their dull luster increases.
cobblemon.species.mimejr.name: Mime Jr.
cobblemon.species.mimejr.desc1: It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra effort into copying the graceful dance steps of Mr. Rime as practice.
cobblemon.species.mimejr.desc2: It looks for a Mr. Rime that’s a good dancer and carefully copies the Mr. Rime’s steps like an apprentice.
cobblemon.species.happiny.name: Happiny
cobblemon.species.happiny.desc1: Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg- shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will treasure this stone.
cobblemon.species.happiny.desc2: Happiny’s willing to lend its precious round stone to those it’s friendly with, but if the stone isn’t returned, Happiny will cry and throw a tantrum.
cobblemon.species.chatot.name: Chatot
cobblemon.species.chatot.desc1: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t attack it.
cobblemon.species.chatot.desc2: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
cobblemon.species.spiritomb.name: Spiritomb
cobblemon.species.spiritomb.desc1: Exactly 108 spirits gathered to become this Pokémon. Apparently there are some ill-natured spirits in the mix.
cobblemon.species.spiritomb.desc2: All Spiritomb’s mischief and misdeeds compelled a traveler to use a mysterious spell to bind Spiritomb to an odd keystone.
cobblemon.species.gible.name: Gible
cobblemon.species.gible.desc1: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.
cobblemon.species.gible.desc2: Gible attacks anything that moves, and it drags whatever it catches into the crevice that is its lair. Despite the big mouth, Gible’s stomach is small.
cobblemon.species.munchlax.name: Munchlax
cobblemon.species.munchlax.desc1: Stuffing itself with vast amounts of food is its only concern. Whether the food is rotten or fresh, yummy or tasteless—it does not care.
cobblemon.species.munchlax.desc2: It stores food beneath its fur. It might share just one bite, but only if it really trusts you.
cobblemon.species.riolu.name: Riolu
cobblemon.species.riolu.desc1: It’s exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.
cobblemon.species.riolu.desc2: It can use waves called auras to gauge how others are feeling. These same waves can also tell this Pokémon about the state of the environment.
cobblemon.species.hippopotas.name: Hippopotas
cobblemon.species.hippopotas.desc1: It moves through the sands with its mouth open, swallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of the sand by spouting it from its nose.
cobblemon.species.hippopotas.desc2: This Pokémon is active during the day and passes the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into the sand.
cobblemon.species.skorupi.name: Skorupi
cobblemon.species.skorupi.desc1: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokémon and Sizzlipede share common descent.
cobblemon.species.skorupi.desc2: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon’s poison seeps in.
cobblemon.species.croagunk.name: Croagunk
cobblemon.species.croagunk.desc1: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.
cobblemon.species.croagunk.desc2: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.
cobblemon.species.carnivine.name: Carnivine
cobblemon.species.carnivine.desc1: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
cobblemon.species.carnivine.desc2: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
cobblemon.species.finneon.name: Finneon
cobblemon.species.finneon.desc1: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They’re popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.
cobblemon.species.finneon.desc2: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.
cobblemon.species.mantyke.name: Mantyke
cobblemon.species.mantyke.desc1: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.
cobblemon.species.mantyke.desc2: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.
cobblemon.species.snover.name: Snover
cobblemon.species.snover.desc1: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.
cobblemon.species.snover.desc2: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.
cobblemon.species.rotom.name: Rotom
cobblemon.species.rotom.desc1: One boy’s invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotom’s unique capabilities.
cobblemon.species.rotom.desc2: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.
cobblemon.species.uxie.name: Uxie
cobblemon.species.uxie.desc1: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
cobblemon.species.uxie.desc2: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
cobblemon.species.mesprit.name: Mesprit
cobblemon.species.mesprit.desc1: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
cobblemon.species.mesprit.desc2: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.
cobblemon.species.azelf.name: Azelf
