cobblemon.species.azelf.desc1: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
cobblemon.species.azelf.desc2: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.
cobblemon.species.dialga.name: Dialga
cobblemon.species.dialga.desc1: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.
cobblemon.species.dialga.desc2: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
cobblemon.species.palkia.name: Palkia
cobblemon.species.palkia.desc1: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.
cobblemon.species.palkia.desc2: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
cobblemon.species.heatran.name: Heatran
cobblemon.species.heatran.desc1: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
cobblemon.species.heatran.desc2: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
cobblemon.species.regigigas.name: Regigigas
cobblemon.species.regigigas.desc1: All over the world, there are legends that tell of Regigigas creating other Pokémon in its own image.
cobblemon.species.regigigas.desc2: It’s said that Regigigas created other Pokémon from many different materials before it moved the continents to where they are today.
cobblemon.species.giratina.name: Giratina
cobblemon.species.giratina.desc1: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
cobblemon.species.giratina.desc2: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
cobblemon.species.cresselia.name: Cresselia
cobblemon.species.cresselia.desc1: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
cobblemon.species.cresselia.desc2: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
cobblemon.species.phione.name: Phione
cobblemon.species.phione.desc1: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
cobblemon.species.phione.desc2: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
cobblemon.species.manaphy.name: Manaphy
cobblemon.species.manaphy.desc1: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.manaphy.desc2: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.darkrai.name: Darkrai
cobblemon.species.darkrai.desc1: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
cobblemon.species.darkrai.desc2: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
cobblemon.species.shaymin.name: Shaymin
cobblemon.species.shaymin.desc1: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
cobblemon.species.shaymin.desc2: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
cobblemon.species.arceus.name: Arceus
cobblemon.species.arceus.desc1: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
cobblemon.species.arceus.desc2: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
cobblemon.species.victini.name: Victini
cobblemon.species.victini.desc1: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
cobblemon.species.victini.desc2: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.
cobblemon.species.snivy.name: Snivy
cobblemon.species.snivy.desc1: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
cobblemon.species.snivy.desc2: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
cobblemon.species.tepig.name: Tepig
cobblemon.species.tepig.desc1: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
cobblemon.species.tepig.desc2: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
cobblemon.species.oshawott.name: Oshawott
cobblemon.species.oshawott.desc1: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
cobblemon.species.oshawott.desc2: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
cobblemon.species.patrat.name: Patrat
cobblemon.species.patrat.desc1: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
cobblemon.species.patrat.desc2: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.
cobblemon.species.lillipup.name: Lillipup
cobblemon.species.lillipup.desc1: This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.lillipup.desc2: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.
cobblemon.species.purrloin.name: Purrloin
cobblemon.species.purrloin.desc1: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.
cobblemon.species.purrloin.desc2: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
cobblemon.species.pansage.name: Pansage
cobblemon.species.pansage.desc1: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.
cobblemon.species.pansage.desc2: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.
cobblemon.species.pansear.name: Pansear
cobblemon.species.pansear.desc1: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
cobblemon.species.pansear.desc2: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.panpour.name: Panpour
cobblemon.species.panpour.desc1: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.
cobblemon.species.panpour.desc2: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
cobblemon.species.munna.name: Munna
cobblemon.species.munna.desc1: Late at night, it appears beside people’s pillows. As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body give off a faint glow.
cobblemon.species.munna.desc2: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.
cobblemon.species.pidove.name: Pidove
cobblemon.species.pidove.desc1: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you’re scattering food for them, be careful— several hundred of them can gather at once.
cobblemon.species.pidove.desc2: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.
cobblemon.species.blitzle.name: Blitzle
cobblemon.species.blitzle.desc1: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
cobblemon.species.blitzle.desc2: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
cobblemon.species.roggenrola.name: Roggenrola
cobblemon.species.roggenrola.desc1: It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in water will cause it to soften a bit.
cobblemon.species.roggenrola.desc2: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.
cobblemon.species.woobat.name: Woobat
cobblemon.species.woobat.desc1: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s evidence that Woobat live there.
cobblemon.species.woobat.desc2: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.drilbur.name: Drilbur
cobblemon.species.drilbur.desc1: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.
cobblemon.species.drilbur.desc2: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.
cobblemon.species.audino.name: Audino
cobblemon.species.audino.desc1: Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape Audino’s ears.
cobblemon.species.audino.desc2: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’ feelings and physical conditions.
cobblemon.species.timburr.name: Timburr
cobblemon.species.timburr.desc1: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.
cobblemon.species.timburr.desc2: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.
cobblemon.species.tympole.name: Tympole
cobblemon.species.tympole.desc1: Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.
cobblemon.species.tympole.desc2: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.
cobblemon.species.throh.name: Throh
cobblemon.species.throh.desc1: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.
cobblemon.species.throh.desc2: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.
cobblemon.species.sawk.name: Sawk
cobblemon.species.sawk.desc1: If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.
cobblemon.species.sawk.desc2: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
cobblemon.species.sewaddle.name: Sewaddle
cobblemon.species.sewaddle.desc1: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
cobblemon.species.sewaddle.desc2: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
cobblemon.species.venipede.name: Venipede
cobblemon.species.venipede.desc1: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
cobblemon.species.venipede.desc2: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.
cobblemon.species.cottonee.name: Cottonee
cobblemon.species.cottonee.desc1: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
cobblemon.species.cottonee.desc2: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.
cobblemon.species.petilil.name: Petilil
cobblemon.species.petilil.desc1: Petilil appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in a liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.
cobblemon.species.petilil.desc2: The deeper the color of a Petilil’s leaves, the healthier the Pokémon is. Petilil sometimes makes its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.
cobblemon.species.basculin.name: Basculin
cobblemon.species.basculin.desc1: Anglers love the fight this Pokémon puts up on the hook. And there are always more to catch— many people release them into lakes illicitly.
cobblemon.species.basculin.desc2: In the past, it often appeared on the dinner table. The meat of red-striped Basculin is on the fatty side, and it’s more popular with the youth.
cobblemon.species.sandile.name: Sandile
cobblemon.species.sandile.desc1: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.
cobblemon.species.sandile.desc2: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.
cobblemon.species.darumaka.name: Darumaka
cobblemon.species.darumaka.desc1: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will immediately fall asleep.
cobblemon.species.darumaka.desc2: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.
cobblemon.species.maractus.name: Maractus
cobblemon.species.maractus.desc1: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
cobblemon.species.maractus.desc2: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.
cobblemon.species.dwebble.name: Dwebble
cobblemon.species.dwebble.desc1: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
cobblemon.species.dwebble.desc2: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
cobblemon.species.scraggy.name: Scraggy
cobblemon.species.scraggy.desc1: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.scraggy.desc2: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.
cobblemon.species.sigilyph.name: Sigilyph
cobblemon.species.sigilyph.desc1: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.
cobblemon.species.sigilyph.desc2: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
cobblemon.species.yamask.name: Yamask
cobblemon.species.yamask.desc1: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.
cobblemon.species.yamask.desc2: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.
cobblemon.species.tirtouga.name: Tirtouga
cobblemon.species.tirtouga.desc1: This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.
cobblemon.species.tirtouga.desc2: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.
cobblemon.species.archen.name: Archen
cobblemon.species.archen.desc1: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.
cobblemon.species.archen.desc2: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.trubbish.name: Trubbish
cobblemon.species.trubbish.desc1: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.
cobblemon.species.trubbish.desc2: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.
cobblemon.species.zorua.name: Zorua
cobblemon.species.zorua.desc1: Zorua is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems to be what led to the development of Zorua’s ability to take on the forms of other creatures.
cobblemon.species.zorua.desc2: Zorua sometimes transforms into a person and goes into cities to search for food. When Zorua does this, it usually takes on the form of a child.
cobblemon.species.minccino.name: Minccino
cobblemon.species.minccino.desc1: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
cobblemon.species.minccino.desc2: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.
cobblemon.species.gothita.name: Gothita
cobblemon.species.gothita.desc1: Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.
cobblemon.species.gothita.desc2: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it’s speaking to something only it can see.
cobblemon.species.solosis.name: Solosis
cobblemon.species.solosis.desc1: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.
cobblemon.species.solosis.desc2: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.
cobblemon.species.ducklett.name: Ducklett
cobblemon.species.ducklett.desc1: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
cobblemon.species.ducklett.desc2: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
cobblemon.species.vanillite.name: Vanillite
cobblemon.species.vanillite.desc1: Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.
cobblemon.species.vanillite.desc2: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
cobblemon.species.deerling.name: Deerling
cobblemon.species.deerling.desc1: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
cobblemon.species.deerling.desc2: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
cobblemon.species.emolga.name: Emolga
cobblemon.species.emolga.desc1: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.
cobblemon.species.emolga.desc2: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.
cobblemon.species.karrablast.name: Karrablast
cobblemon.species.karrablast.desc1: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.
cobblemon.species.karrablast.desc2: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.
cobblemon.species.foongus.name: Foongus
cobblemon.species.foongus.desc1: No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.
cobblemon.species.foongus.desc2: The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.
cobblemon.species.frillish.name: Frillish
cobblemon.species.frillish.desc1: It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.
cobblemon.species.frillish.desc2: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.alomomola.name: Alomomola
cobblemon.species.alomomola.desc1: Fishermen take them along on long voyages, because if you have an Alomomola with you, there’ll be no need for a doctor or medicine.
cobblemon.species.alomomola.desc2: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.
cobblemon.species.joltik.name: Joltik
cobblemon.species.joltik.desc1: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t produce a charge on its own.
cobblemon.species.joltik.desc2: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.
cobblemon.species.ferroseed.name: Ferroseed
cobblemon.species.ferroseed.desc1: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.
cobblemon.species.ferroseed.desc2: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.
cobblemon.species.klink.name: Klink
cobblemon.species.klink.desc1: The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.
cobblemon.species.klink.desc2: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.
cobblemon.species.tynamo.name: Tynamo
cobblemon.species.tynamo.desc1: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
cobblemon.species.tynamo.desc2: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
cobblemon.species.elgyem.name: Elgyem
cobblemon.species.elgyem.desc1: If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.
cobblemon.species.elgyem.desc2: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.
cobblemon.species.litwick.name: Litwick
cobblemon.species.litwick.desc1: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.
cobblemon.species.litwick.desc2: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.
cobblemon.species.axew.name: Axew
cobblemon.species.axew.desc1: These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is also how they test each other’s strength.
cobblemon.species.axew.desc2: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.
cobblemon.species.cubchoo.name: Cubchoo
cobblemon.species.cubchoo.desc1: When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesn’t like.
cobblemon.species.cubchoo.desc2: It sniffles before performing a move, using its frosty snot to provide an icy element to any move that needs it.
cobblemon.species.cryogonal.name: Cryogonal
cobblemon.species.cryogonal.desc1: With its icy chains, Cryogonal freezes those it encounters. It then takes its victims away to somewhere unknown.
cobblemon.species.cryogonal.desc2: When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never seen during summer.
cobblemon.species.shelmet.name: Shelmet
cobblemon.species.shelmet.desc1: When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.
cobblemon.species.shelmet.desc2: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.
cobblemon.species.stunfisk.name: Stunfisk
cobblemon.species.stunfisk.desc1: Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to generate electricity.
cobblemon.species.stunfisk.desc2: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.
cobblemon.species.mienfoo.name: Mienfoo
cobblemon.species.mienfoo.desc1: In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.
cobblemon.species.mienfoo.desc2: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
cobblemon.species.druddigon.name: Druddigon
cobblemon.species.druddigon.desc1: Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body gets too cold.
cobblemon.species.druddigon.desc2: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.
cobblemon.species.golett.name: Golett
cobblemon.species.golett.desc1: They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.
cobblemon.species.golett.desc2: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.
cobblemon.species.pawniard.name: Pawniard
cobblemon.species.pawniard.desc1: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.
cobblemon.species.pawniard.desc2: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.
cobblemon.species.bouffalant.name: Bouffalant
cobblemon.species.bouffalant.desc1: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.
cobblemon.species.bouffalant.desc2: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.
cobblemon.species.rufflet.name: Rufflet
cobblemon.species.rufflet.desc1: If it spies a strong Pokémon, Rufflet can’t resist challenging it to a battle. But if Rufflet loses, it starts bawling.
cobblemon.species.rufflet.desc2: A combative Pokémon, it’s ready to pick a fight with anyone. It has talons that can crush hard berries.
cobblemon.species.vullaby.name: Vullaby
cobblemon.species.vullaby.desc1: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.
cobblemon.species.vullaby.desc2: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.
cobblemon.species.heatmor.name: Heatmor
cobblemon.species.heatmor.desc1: There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.
cobblemon.species.heatmor.desc2: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.
cobblemon.species.durant.name: Durant
cobblemon.species.durant.desc1: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.
cobblemon.species.durant.desc2: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
cobblemon.species.deino.name: Deino
cobblemon.species.deino.desc1: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.
cobblemon.species.deino.desc2: Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.larvesta.name: Larvesta
cobblemon.species.larvesta.desc1: The people of ancient times believed that Larvesta fell from the sun.
cobblemon.species.larvesta.desc2: Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.
cobblemon.species.cobalion.name: Cobalion
cobblemon.species.cobalion.desc1: This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.cobalion.desc2: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.
cobblemon.species.terrakion.name: Terrakion
cobblemon.species.terrakion.desc1: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.terrakion.desc2: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.virizion.name: Virizion
cobblemon.species.virizion.desc1: A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.
cobblemon.species.virizion.desc2: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.
cobblemon.species.tornadus.name: Tornadus
cobblemon.species.tornadus.desc1: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
cobblemon.species.tornadus.desc2: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
cobblemon.species.thundurus.name: Thundurus
cobblemon.species.thundurus.desc1: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
cobblemon.species.thundurus.desc2: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
cobblemon.species.reshiram.name: Reshiram
cobblemon.species.reshiram.desc1: Flames spew from its tail as it flies through the sky like a jet airplane. It’s said that this Pokémon will scorch the world.
cobblemon.species.reshiram.desc2: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.
cobblemon.species.zekrom.name: Zekrom
cobblemon.species.zekrom.desc1: When the interior part of its tail spins like a motor, Zekrom can generate many bolts of lightning to blast its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.zekrom.desc2: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.
cobblemon.species.landorus.name: Landorus
cobblemon.species.landorus.desc1: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”
cobblemon.species.landorus.desc2: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
cobblemon.species.kyurem.name: Kyurem
cobblemon.species.kyurem.desc1: Dwelling within it is a power even greater than that of Reshiram or Zekrom, but the extreme cold keeps that power bound.
cobblemon.species.kyurem.desc2: It appears that this Pokémon uses its powers over ice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its cellular structure.
cobblemon.species.keldeo.name: Keldeo
cobblemon.species.keldeo.desc1: Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion taught this Pokémon how to fight. It dashes across the world, seeking more opportunities to further its training.
cobblemon.species.keldeo.desc2: They say that Keldeo must survive harsh battles and fully develop the horn on its forehead before this Pokémon’s true power will awaken.
cobblemon.species.meloetta.name: Meloetta
cobblemon.species.meloetta.desc1: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.
cobblemon.species.meloetta.desc2: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
cobblemon.species.genesect.name: Genesect
cobblemon.species.genesect.desc1: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
cobblemon.species.genesect.desc2: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
cobblemon.species.chespin.name: Chespin
cobblemon.species.chespin.desc1: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
cobblemon.species.chespin.desc2: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.
cobblemon.species.fennekin.name: Fennekin
cobblemon.species.fennekin.desc1: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.fennekin.desc2: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
cobblemon.species.froakie.name: Froakie
cobblemon.species.froakie.desc1: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
cobblemon.species.froakie.desc2: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.bunnelby.name: Bunnelby
cobblemon.species.bunnelby.desc1: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.
cobblemon.species.bunnelby.desc2: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.
cobblemon.species.fletchling.name: Fletchling
cobblemon.species.fletchling.desc1: Its melodious cries are actually warnings. Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.
cobblemon.species.fletchling.desc2: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.
cobblemon.species.scatterbug.name: Scatterbug
cobblemon.species.scatterbug.desc1: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.
cobblemon.species.scatterbug.desc2: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
cobblemon.species.litleo.name: Litleo
cobblemon.species.litleo.desc1: When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re kicked out and have to make their own way.
cobblemon.species.litleo.desc2: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.
cobblemon.species.flabebe.name: Flabébé
cobblemon.species.flabebe.desc1: It’s not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.
cobblemon.species.flabebe.desc2: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.
cobblemon.species.skiddo.name: Skiddo
cobblemon.species.skiddo.desc1: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
cobblemon.species.skiddo.desc2: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
cobblemon.species.pancham.name: Pancham
cobblemon.species.pancham.desc1: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.
cobblemon.species.pancham.desc2: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.
cobblemon.species.furfrou.name: Furfrou
cobblemon.species.furfrou.desc1: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.
cobblemon.species.furfrou.desc2: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.
cobblemon.species.espurr.name: Espurr
cobblemon.species.espurr.desc1: Though Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.
cobblemon.species.espurr.desc2: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.
cobblemon.species.honedge.name: Honedge
cobblemon.species.honedge.desc1: Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.
cobblemon.species.honedge.desc2: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.
cobblemon.species.spritzee.name: Spritzee
cobblemon.species.spritzee.desc1: A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.
cobblemon.species.spritzee.desc2: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.
cobblemon.species.swirlix.name: Swirlix
cobblemon.species.swirlix.desc1: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.
cobblemon.species.swirlix.desc2: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
cobblemon.species.inkay.name: Inkay
cobblemon.species.inkay.desc1: It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.
cobblemon.species.inkay.desc2: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.
cobblemon.species.binacle.name: Binacle
cobblemon.species.binacle.desc1: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.
cobblemon.species.binacle.desc2: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.
cobblemon.species.skrelp.name: Skrelp
cobblemon.species.skrelp.desc1: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.
cobblemon.species.skrelp.desc2: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.
cobblemon.species.clauncher.name: Clauncher
cobblemon.species.clauncher.desc1: Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is popular as a delicacy in Galar.
cobblemon.species.clauncher.desc2: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.
cobblemon.species.helioptile.name: Helioptile
cobblemon.species.helioptile.desc1: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.
cobblemon.species.helioptile.desc2: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.
cobblemon.species.tyrunt.name: Tyrunt
cobblemon.species.tyrunt.desc1: This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.
cobblemon.species.tyrunt.desc2: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.
cobblemon.species.amaura.name: Amaura
cobblemon.species.amaura.desc1: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.
cobblemon.species.amaura.desc2: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.
cobblemon.species.hawlucha.name: Hawlucha
cobblemon.species.hawlucha.desc1: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.
cobblemon.species.hawlucha.desc2: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.
cobblemon.species.dedenne.name: Dedenne
cobblemon.species.dedenne.desc1: A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.
cobblemon.species.dedenne.desc2: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.carbink.name: Carbink
cobblemon.species.carbink.desc1: When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.
cobblemon.species.carbink.desc2: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.
cobblemon.species.goomy.name: Goomy
cobblemon.species.goomy.desc1: Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.goomy.desc2: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they’ve survived.
cobblemon.species.klefki.name: Klefki
cobblemon.species.klefki.desc1: This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.
cobblemon.species.klefki.desc2: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
cobblemon.species.phantump.name: Phantump
cobblemon.species.phantump.desc1: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.phantump.desc2: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
cobblemon.species.pumpkaboo.name: Pumpkaboo
cobblemon.species.pumpkaboo.desc1: Spirits that wander this world are placed into Pumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.pumpkaboo.desc2: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.
cobblemon.species.bergmite.name: Bergmite
cobblemon.species.bergmite.desc1: They chill the air around them to −150 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice that they use as armor.
cobblemon.species.bergmite.desc2: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.
cobblemon.species.noibat.name: Noibat
cobblemon.species.noibat.desc1: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.
cobblemon.species.noibat.desc2: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.xerneas.name: Xerneas
cobblemon.species.xerneas.desc1: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
cobblemon.species.xerneas.desc2: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
cobblemon.species.yveltal.name: Yveltal
cobblemon.species.yveltal.desc1: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
cobblemon.species.yveltal.desc2: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
cobblemon.species.zygarde.name: Zygarde
cobblemon.species.zygarde.desc1: This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.
cobblemon.species.zygarde.desc2: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
cobblemon.species.diancie.name: Diancie
cobblemon.species.diancie.desc1: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
cobblemon.species.diancie.desc2: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
cobblemon.species.hoopa.name: Hoopa
cobblemon.species.hoopa.desc1: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
cobblemon.species.hoopa.desc2: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
cobblemon.species.volcanion.name: Volcanion
cobblemon.species.volcanion.desc1: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
cobblemon.species.volcanion.desc2: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
cobblemon.species.rowlet.name: Rowlet
cobblemon.species.rowlet.desc1: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.
cobblemon.species.rowlet.desc2: During the day, it builds up energy via photosynthesis. At night, it flies silently through the sky, on the prowl for prey.
cobblemon.species.litten.name: Litten
cobblemon.species.litten.desc1: It spends even the smallest amount of downtime grooming its fur with its tongue. Loose fur gathers in its stomach and serves as fuel for fiery moves.
cobblemon.species.litten.desc2: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.
cobblemon.species.popplio.name: Popplio
cobblemon.species.popplio.desc1: It creates special bouncy balloons to send at its opponents. When the balloons pop, the sheer force of their bursting is what deals damage.
cobblemon.species.popplio.desc2: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.
cobblemon.species.pikipek.name: Pikipek
cobblemon.species.pikipek.desc1: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
cobblemon.species.pikipek.desc2: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
cobblemon.species.yungoos.name: Yungoos
cobblemon.species.yungoos.desc1: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It’s a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.
cobblemon.species.yungoos.desc2: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
cobblemon.species.grubbin.name: Grubbin
cobblemon.species.grubbin.desc1: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.
cobblemon.species.grubbin.desc2: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.
cobblemon.species.crabrawler.name: Crabrawler
cobblemon.species.crabrawler.desc1: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.
cobblemon.species.crabrawler.desc2: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.
cobblemon.species.oricorio.name: Oricorio
cobblemon.species.oricorio.desc1: It wins the hearts of its enemies with its passionate dancing and then uses the opening it creates to burn them up with blazing flames.
cobblemon.species.oricorio.desc2: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
cobblemon.species.cutiefly.name: Cutiefly
cobblemon.species.cutiefly.desc1: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.
cobblemon.species.cutiefly.desc2: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.
cobblemon.species.rockruff.name: Rockruff
cobblemon.species.rockruff.desc1: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.
cobblemon.species.rockruff.desc2: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
cobblemon.species.wishiwashi.name: Wishiwashi
cobblemon.species.wishiwashi.desc1: Individually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by gathering up into schools that they’re able to confront opponents.
cobblemon.species.wishiwashi.desc2: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.
cobblemon.species.mareanie.name: Mareanie
cobblemon.species.mareanie.desc1: The first symptom of its sting is numbness. The next is an itching sensation so intense that it’s impossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.
cobblemon.species.mareanie.desc2: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.
cobblemon.species.mudbray.name: Mudbray
cobblemon.species.mudbray.desc1: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It’s skilled at making use of mud.
cobblemon.species.mudbray.desc2: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.
cobblemon.species.dewpider.name: Dewpider
cobblemon.species.dewpider.desc1: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.
cobblemon.species.dewpider.desc2: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.
cobblemon.species.fomantis.name: Fomantis
cobblemon.species.fomantis.desc1: When bathed in sunlight, this Pokémon emits a pleasantly sweet scent, which causes bug Pokémon to gather around it.
cobblemon.species.fomantis.desc2: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.
cobblemon.species.morelull.name: Morelull
cobblemon.species.morelull.desc1: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.
cobblemon.species.morelull.desc2: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.
cobblemon.species.salandit.name: Salandit
cobblemon.species.salandit.desc1: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.
cobblemon.species.salandit.desc2: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.
cobblemon.species.stufful.name: Stufful
cobblemon.species.stufful.desc1: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.
cobblemon.species.stufful.desc2: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.
cobblemon.species.bounsweet.name: Bounsweet
cobblemon.species.bounsweet.desc1: Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.bounsweet.desc2: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.
cobblemon.species.comfey.name: Comfey
cobblemon.species.comfey.desc1: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.
cobblemon.species.comfey.desc2: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.
cobblemon.species.oranguru.name: Oranguru
cobblemon.species.oranguru.desc1: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.oranguru.desc2: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.
cobblemon.species.passimian.name: Passimian
cobblemon.species.passimian.desc1: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.
cobblemon.species.passimian.desc2: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.
cobblemon.species.wimpod.name: Wimpod
cobblemon.species.wimpod.desc1: It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.
cobblemon.species.wimpod.desc2: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.
cobblemon.species.sandygast.name: Sandygast
cobblemon.species.sandygast.desc1: Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.
cobblemon.species.sandygast.desc2: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.
cobblemon.species.pyukumuku.name: Pyukumuku
cobblemon.species.pyukumuku.desc1: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
cobblemon.species.pyukumuku.desc2: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.
cobblemon.species.typenull.name: Type: Null
cobblemon.species.typenull.desc1: Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.
cobblemon.species.typenull.desc2: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.
cobblemon.species.minior.name: Minior
cobblemon.species.minior.desc1: It lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.
cobblemon.species.minior.desc2: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.
cobblemon.species.komala.name: Komala
cobblemon.species.komala.desc1: It stays asleep from the moment it’s born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.
cobblemon.species.komala.desc2: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.
cobblemon.species.turtonator.name: Turtonator
cobblemon.species.turtonator.desc1: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.
cobblemon.species.turtonator.desc2: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.
cobblemon.species.togedemaru.name: Togedemaru
cobblemon.species.togedemaru.desc1: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.
cobblemon.species.togedemaru.desc2: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.
cobblemon.species.mimikyu.name: Mimikyu
cobblemon.species.mimikyu.desc1: It wears a rag fashioned into a Pikachu costume in an effort to look less scary. Unfortunately, the costume only makes it creepier.
cobblemon.species.mimikyu.desc2: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.
cobblemon.species.bruxish.name: Bruxish
cobblemon.species.bruxish.desc1: It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.
cobblemon.species.bruxish.desc2: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.
cobblemon.species.drampa.name: Drampa
cobblemon.species.drampa.desc1: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.
cobblemon.species.drampa.desc2: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.
cobblemon.species.dhelmise.name: Dhelmise
cobblemon.species.dhelmise.desc1: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.dhelmise.desc2: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.
cobblemon.species.jangmoo.name: Jangmo-o
cobblemon.species.jangmoo.desc1: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.
cobblemon.species.jangmoo.desc2: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.
cobblemon.species.tapukoko.name: Tapu Koko
cobblemon.species.tapukoko.desc1: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.
cobblemon.species.tapukoko.desc2: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.
cobblemon.species.tapulele.name: Tapu Lele
cobblemon.species.tapulele.desc1: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.
cobblemon.species.tapulele.desc2: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.
cobblemon.species.tapubulu.name: Tapu Bulu
cobblemon.species.tapubulu.desc1: Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.
cobblemon.species.tapubulu.desc2: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.
cobblemon.species.tapufini.name: Tapu Fini
cobblemon.species.tapufini.desc1: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.
cobblemon.species.tapufini.desc2: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.
cobblemon.species.cosmog.name: Cosmog
cobblemon.species.cosmog.desc1: This Pokémon came from another universe. Its gaseous body is so light that even a gentle breeze can blow it away.
cobblemon.species.cosmog.desc2: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.
cobblemon.species.nihilego.name: Nihilego
cobblemon.species.nihilego.desc1: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
cobblemon.species.nihilego.desc2: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.buzzwole.name: Buzzwole
cobblemon.species.buzzwole.desc1: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.buzzwole.desc2: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
cobblemon.species.pheromosa.name: Pheromosa
cobblemon.species.pheromosa.desc1: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
cobblemon.species.pheromosa.desc2: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.xurkitree.name: Xurkitree
cobblemon.species.xurkitree.desc1: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.xurkitree.desc2: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
cobblemon.species.celesteela.name: Celesteela
cobblemon.species.celesteela.desc1: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
cobblemon.species.celesteela.desc2: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.kartana.name: Kartana
cobblemon.species.kartana.desc1: This Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
cobblemon.species.kartana.desc2: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.guzzlord.name: Guzzlord
cobblemon.species.guzzlord.desc1: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.guzzlord.desc2: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.
cobblemon.species.necrozma.name: Necrozma
cobblemon.species.necrozma.desc1: It survives by absorbing light. After a long time spent slumbering underground, impurities accumulated within it, causing its body to darken.
cobblemon.species.necrozma.desc2: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.
cobblemon.species.magearna.name: Magearna
cobblemon.species.magearna.desc1: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.
cobblemon.species.magearna.desc2: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.
cobblemon.species.marshadow.name: Marshadow
cobblemon.species.marshadow.desc1: By slipping into the shadow of a martial arts master and copying their movements, this Pokémon learned the ultimate techniques.
cobblemon.species.marshadow.desc2: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.
cobblemon.species.poipole.name: Poipole
cobblemon.species.poipole.desc1: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
cobblemon.species.poipole.desc2: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
cobblemon.species.stakataka.name: Stakataka
cobblemon.species.stakataka.desc1: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
cobblemon.species.stakataka.desc2: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
cobblemon.species.blacephalon.name: Blacephalon
cobblemon.species.blacephalon.desc1: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
cobblemon.species.blacephalon.desc2: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.
cobblemon.species.zeraora.name: Zeraora
cobblemon.species.zeraora.desc1: It runs as fast as lightning strikes, shredding its opponents with its high-voltage claws.
cobblemon.species.zeraora.desc2: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.
cobblemon.species.meltan.name: Meltan
cobblemon.species.meltan.desc1: It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.
cobblemon.species.meltan.desc2: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.
cobblemon.species.melmetal.name: Melmetal
cobblemon.species.melmetal.desc1: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
cobblemon.species.melmetal.desc2: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.grookey.name: Grookey
cobblemon.species.grookey.desc1: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
cobblemon.species.grookey.desc2: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.
cobblemon.species.scorbunny.name: Scorbunny
cobblemon.species.scorbunny.desc1: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.
cobblemon.species.scorbunny.desc2: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.
cobblemon.species.sobble.name: Sobble
cobblemon.species.sobble.desc1: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.
cobblemon.species.sobble.desc2: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
cobblemon.species.skwovet.name: Skwovet
cobblemon.species.skwovet.desc1: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
cobblemon.species.skwovet.desc2: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.
cobblemon.species.rookidee.name: Rookidee
cobblemon.species.rookidee.desc1: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
cobblemon.species.rookidee.desc2: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.
cobblemon.species.blipbug.name: Blipbug
cobblemon.species.blipbug.desc1: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
cobblemon.species.blipbug.desc2: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.nickit.name: Nickit
cobblemon.species.nickit.desc1: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
cobblemon.species.nickit.desc2: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
cobblemon.species.gossifleur.name: Gossifleur
cobblemon.species.gossifleur.desc1: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
cobblemon.species.gossifleur.desc2: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.wooloo.name: Wooloo
cobblemon.species.wooloo.desc1: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
cobblemon.species.wooloo.desc2: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.
cobblemon.species.chewtle.name: Chewtle
cobblemon.species.chewtle.desc1: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
cobblemon.species.chewtle.desc2: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.
cobblemon.species.yamper.name: Yamper
cobblemon.species.yamper.desc1: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.
cobblemon.species.yamper.desc2: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
cobblemon.species.rolycoly.name: Rolycoly
cobblemon.species.rolycoly.desc1: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.
cobblemon.species.rolycoly.desc2: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
cobblemon.species.applin.name: Applin
cobblemon.species.applin.desc1: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.
cobblemon.species.applin.desc2: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.
cobblemon.species.silicobra.name: Silicobra
cobblemon.species.silicobra.desc1: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
cobblemon.species.silicobra.desc2: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
cobblemon.species.cramorant.name: Cramorant
cobblemon.species.cramorant.desc1: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.
cobblemon.species.cramorant.desc2: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.
cobblemon.species.arrokuda.name: Arrokuda
cobblemon.species.arrokuda.desc1: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.
cobblemon.species.arrokuda.desc2: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.
cobblemon.species.toxel.name: Toxel
cobblemon.species.toxel.desc1: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
cobblemon.species.toxel.desc2: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.
cobblemon.species.sizzlipede.name: Sizzlipede
cobblemon.species.sizzlipede.desc1: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
cobblemon.species.sizzlipede.desc2: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
cobblemon.species.clobbopus.name: Clobbopus
cobblemon.species.clobbopus.desc1: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
cobblemon.species.clobbopus.desc2: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.
cobblemon.species.sinistea.name: Sinistea
cobblemon.species.sinistea.desc1: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
cobblemon.species.sinistea.desc2: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.
cobblemon.species.hatenna.name: Hatenna
cobblemon.species.hatenna.desc1: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
cobblemon.species.hatenna.desc2: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.
cobblemon.species.impidimp.name: Impidimp
cobblemon.species.impidimp.desc1: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
cobblemon.species.impidimp.desc2: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.
cobblemon.species.milcery.name: Milcery
cobblemon.species.milcery.desc1: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
cobblemon.species.milcery.desc2: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
cobblemon.species.falinks.name: Falinks
cobblemon.species.falinks.desc1: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass’s orders are absolute.
cobblemon.species.falinks.desc2: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.
cobblemon.species.pincurchin.name: Pincurchin
cobblemon.species.pincurchin.desc1: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
cobblemon.species.pincurchin.desc2: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.
cobblemon.species.snom.name: Snom
cobblemon.species.snom.desc1: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
cobblemon.species.snom.desc2: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.
cobblemon.species.stonjourner.name: Stonjourner
cobblemon.species.stonjourner.desc1: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.
cobblemon.species.stonjourner.desc2: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
cobblemon.species.eiscue.name: Eiscue
cobblemon.species.eiscue.desc1: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
cobblemon.species.eiscue.desc2: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.
cobblemon.species.indeedee.name: Indeedee
cobblemon.species.indeedee.desc1: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
cobblemon.species.indeedee.desc2: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.
cobblemon.species.morpeko.name: Morpeko
cobblemon.species.morpeko.desc1: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.
cobblemon.species.morpeko.desc2: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
cobblemon.species.cufant.name: Cufant
cobblemon.species.cufant.desc1: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
cobblemon.species.cufant.desc2: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.
cobblemon.species.dracozolt.name: Dracozolt
cobblemon.species.dracozolt.desc1: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
cobblemon.species.dracozolt.desc2: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.
cobblemon.species.arctozolt.name: Arctozolt
cobblemon.species.arctozolt.desc1: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
cobblemon.species.arctozolt.desc2: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
cobblemon.species.dracovish.name: Dracovish
cobblemon.species.dracovish.desc1: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
cobblemon.species.dracovish.desc2: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.
cobblemon.species.arctovish.name: Arctovish
cobblemon.species.arctovish.desc1: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
cobblemon.species.arctovish.desc2: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.
cobblemon.species.duraludon.name: Duraludon
cobblemon.species.duraludon.desc1: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
cobblemon.species.duraludon.desc2: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
cobblemon.species.dreepy.name: Dreepy
cobblemon.species.dreepy.desc1: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
cobblemon.species.dreepy.desc2: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.
cobblemon.species.zacian.name: Zacian
cobblemon.species.zacian.desc1: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
cobblemon.species.zacian.desc2: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.
cobblemon.species.zamazenta.name: Zamazenta
cobblemon.species.zamazenta.desc1: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
cobblemon.species.zamazenta.desc2: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
cobblemon.species.eternatus.name: Eternatus
cobblemon.species.eternatus.desc1: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.
cobblemon.species.eternatus.desc2: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
cobblemon.species.kubfu.name: Kubfu
cobblemon.species.kubfu.desc1: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.
cobblemon.species.kubfu.desc2: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
cobblemon.species.zarude.name: Zarude
