cobblemon.species.cherrim.desc2: Its folded petals are pretty tough. Bird Pokémon can peck at them all they want, and Cherrim won’t be bothered at all.
cobblemon.species.gastrodon.name: Gastrodon
cobblemon.species.gastrodon.desc1: Its search for food sometimes leads it onto land, where it leaves behind a sticky trail of slime as it passes through.
cobblemon.species.gastrodon.desc2: The softness of its body helps disperse the force of impacts, so although its body is uncommonly squishy, it’s also surprisingly resilient.
cobblemon.species.ambipom.name: Ambipom
cobblemon.species.ambipom.desc1: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.
cobblemon.species.ambipom.desc2: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that’s proof it really likes you.
cobblemon.species.drifblim.name: Drifblim
cobblemon.species.drifblim.desc1: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.
cobblemon.species.drifblim.desc2: It grabs people and Pokémon and carries them off somewhere. Where do they go? Nobody knows.
cobblemon.species.lopunny.name: Lopunny
cobblemon.species.lopunny.desc1: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.
cobblemon.species.lopunny.desc2: Once hot seasons are over, Lopunny’s coat will be replaced with fur that holds a lot of insulating air in preparation for colder weather.
cobblemon.species.mismagius.name: Mismagius
cobblemon.species.mismagius.desc1: Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads, this Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells that help people.
cobblemon.species.mismagius.desc2: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.
cobblemon.species.honchkrow.name: Honchkrow
cobblemon.species.honchkrow.desc1: It will absolutely not forgive failure from or betrayal by its goons. It has no choice in this if it wants to maintain the order of the flock.
cobblemon.species.honchkrow.desc2: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.
cobblemon.species.purugly.name: Purugly
cobblemon.species.purugly.desc1: It would claim another Pokémon’s nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
cobblemon.species.purugly.desc2: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
cobblemon.species.skuntank.name: Skuntank
cobblemon.species.skuntank.desc1: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokémon’s diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.
cobblemon.species.skuntank.desc2: It digs holes in the ground to make its nest. The stench of the fluid it lets fly from the tip of its tail is extremely potent.
cobblemon.species.bronzong.name: Bronzong
cobblemon.species.bronzong.desc1: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.
cobblemon.species.bronzong.desc2: Many scientists suspect that this Pokémon originated outside the Galar region, based on the patterns on its body.
cobblemon.species.gabite.name: Gabite
cobblemon.species.gabite.desc1: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a protrusion on either side of its head to probe pitch-dark caves.
cobblemon.species.gabite.desc2: Jewels are buried in the caves these Pokémon nest in, but you’ll be torn apart by claws and fangs the moment you enter one of these caves.
cobblemon.species.garchomp.name: Garchomp
cobblemon.species.garchomp.desc1: Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains. It flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane, hunting down as much prey as it can.
cobblemon.species.garchomp.desc2: Garchomp is fast both underground and above. It can bring down prey and return to its den before its body has chilled from being outside.
cobblemon.species.lucario.name: Lucario
cobblemon.species.lucario.desc1: It controls waves known as auras, which are powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks. It uses these waves to take down its prey.
cobblemon.species.lucario.desc2: It can tell what people are thinking. Only Trainers who have justice in their hearts can earn this Pokémon’s trust.
cobblemon.species.hippowdon.name: Hippowdon
cobblemon.species.hippowdon.desc1: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.hippowdon.desc2: When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out the quantities of sand it has swallowed and whips up a sandstorm.
cobblemon.species.drapion.name: Drapion
cobblemon.species.drapion.desc1: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.
cobblemon.species.drapion.desc2: It’s so vicious that it’s called the Sand Demon. Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.
cobblemon.species.toxicroak.name: Toxicroak
cobblemon.species.toxicroak.desc1: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.
cobblemon.species.toxicroak.desc2: It booms out a victory croak when its prey goes down in defeat. This Pokémon and Seismitoad are related species.
cobblemon.species.lumineon.name: Lumineon
cobblemon.species.lumineon.desc1: Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with Lanturn over food.
cobblemon.species.lumineon.desc2: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.
cobblemon.species.abomasnow.name: Abomasnow
cobblemon.species.abomasnow.desc1: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.
cobblemon.species.abomasnow.desc2: This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.
cobblemon.species.weavile.name: Weavile
cobblemon.species.weavile.desc1: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.
cobblemon.species.weavile.desc2: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.
cobblemon.species.magnezone.name: Magnezone
cobblemon.species.magnezone.desc1: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it’s being controlled by some mysterious being.
cobblemon.species.magnezone.desc2: It’s thought that a special magnetic field changed the molecular structure of this Pokémon’s body, and that’s what caused the Pokémon’s evolution.
cobblemon.species.lickilicky.name: Lickilicky
cobblemon.species.lickilicky.desc1: Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.
cobblemon.species.lickilicky.desc2: Lickilicky can do just about anything with its tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand. In contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.
cobblemon.species.rhyperior.name: Rhyperior
cobblemon.species.rhyperior.desc1: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
cobblemon.species.rhyperior.desc2: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.
cobblemon.species.tangrowth.name: Tangrowth
cobblemon.species.tangrowth.desc1: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
cobblemon.species.tangrowth.desc2: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.
cobblemon.species.electivire.name: Electivire
cobblemon.species.electivire.desc1: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
cobblemon.species.electivire.desc2: In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire is one of the best among all Electric Pokémon. It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.
cobblemon.species.magmortar.name: Magmortar
cobblemon.species.magmortar.desc1: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.magmortar.desc2: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokémon’s body to resemble its environment— it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.
cobblemon.species.togekiss.name: Togekiss
cobblemon.species.togekiss.desc1: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.
cobblemon.species.togekiss.desc2: Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.
cobblemon.species.yanmega.name: Yanmega
cobblemon.species.yanmega.desc1: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
cobblemon.species.yanmega.desc2: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
cobblemon.species.leafeon.name: Leafeon
cobblemon.species.leafeon.desc1: Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts from this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular perfume made using that scent.
cobblemon.species.leafeon.desc2: This Pokémon’s tail is blade sharp, with a fantastic cutting edge that can slice right though large trees.
cobblemon.species.glaceon.name: Glaceon
cobblemon.species.glaceon.desc1: Any who become captivated by the beauty of the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen before they know it.
cobblemon.species.glaceon.desc2: The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes powdery snow to form, making it quite a popular Pokémon at ski resorts.
cobblemon.species.gliscor.name: Gliscor
cobblemon.species.gliscor.desc1: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
cobblemon.species.gliscor.desc2: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
cobblemon.species.mamoswine.name: Mamoswine
cobblemon.species.mamoswine.desc1: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.
cobblemon.species.mamoswine.desc2: It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
cobblemon.species.porygonz.name: Porygon-Z
cobblemon.species.porygonz.desc1: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.
cobblemon.species.porygonz.desc2: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.
cobblemon.species.gallade.name: Gallade
cobblemon.species.gallade.desc1: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.
cobblemon.species.gallade.desc2: Sharply attuned to others’ wishes for help, this Pokémon seeks out those in need and aids them in battle.
cobblemon.species.probopass.name: Probopass
cobblemon.species.probopass.desc1: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don’t come back.
cobblemon.species.probopass.desc2: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.
cobblemon.species.dusknoir.name: Dusknoir
cobblemon.species.dusknoir.desc1: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.
cobblemon.species.dusknoir.desc2: With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its target whole. The soul is the only thing eaten— Dusknoir disgorges the body before departing.
cobblemon.species.froslass.name: Froslass
cobblemon.species.froslass.desc1: After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain, her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.
cobblemon.species.froslass.desc2: It spits out cold air of nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.
cobblemon.species.servine.name: Servine
cobblemon.species.servine.desc1: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
cobblemon.species.servine.desc2: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
cobblemon.species.serperior.name: Serperior
cobblemon.species.serperior.desc1: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.
cobblemon.species.serperior.desc2: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
cobblemon.species.pignite.name: Pignite
cobblemon.species.pignite.desc1: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
cobblemon.species.pignite.desc2: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
cobblemon.species.emboar.name: Emboar
cobblemon.species.emboar.desc1: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
cobblemon.species.emboar.desc2: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
cobblemon.species.dewott.name: Dewott
cobblemon.species.dewott.desc1: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
cobblemon.species.dewott.desc2: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
cobblemon.species.samurott.name: Samurott
cobblemon.species.samurott.desc1: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.
cobblemon.species.samurott.desc2: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
cobblemon.species.watchog.name: Watchog
cobblemon.species.watchog.desc1: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
cobblemon.species.watchog.desc2: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
cobblemon.species.herdier.name: Herdier
cobblemon.species.herdier.desc1: Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon. So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was the first Pokémon to partner with people.
cobblemon.species.herdier.desc2: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.
cobblemon.species.stoutland.name: Stoutland
cobblemon.species.stoutland.desc1: These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans. Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up to people in about three days.
cobblemon.species.stoutland.desc2: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.
cobblemon.species.liepard.name: Liepard
cobblemon.species.liepard.desc1: Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.liepard.desc2: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.
cobblemon.species.simisage.name: Simisage
cobblemon.species.simisage.desc1: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.
cobblemon.species.simisage.desc2: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
cobblemon.species.simisear.name: Simisear
cobblemon.species.simisear.desc1: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
cobblemon.species.simisear.desc2: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
cobblemon.species.simipour.name: Simipour
cobblemon.species.simipour.desc1: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
cobblemon.species.simipour.desc2: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
cobblemon.species.musharna.name: Musharna
cobblemon.species.musharna.desc1: When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.
cobblemon.species.musharna.desc2: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.
cobblemon.species.tranquill.name: Tranquill
cobblemon.species.tranquill.desc1: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.
cobblemon.species.tranquill.desc2: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.
cobblemon.species.unfezant.name: Unfezant
cobblemon.species.unfezant.desc1: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.
cobblemon.species.unfezant.desc2: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.
cobblemon.species.zebstrika.name: Zebstrika
cobblemon.species.zebstrika.desc1: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
cobblemon.species.zebstrika.desc2: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
cobblemon.species.boldore.name: Boldore
cobblemon.species.boldore.desc1: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.
cobblemon.species.boldore.desc2: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.
cobblemon.species.gigalith.name: Gigalith
cobblemon.species.gigalith.desc1: This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.
cobblemon.species.gigalith.desc2: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.
cobblemon.species.swoobat.name: Swoobat
cobblemon.species.swoobat.desc1: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a little while.
cobblemon.species.swoobat.desc2: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.
cobblemon.species.excadrill.name: Excadrill
cobblemon.species.excadrill.desc1: It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.
cobblemon.species.excadrill.desc2: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.
cobblemon.species.gurdurr.name: Gurdurr
cobblemon.species.gurdurr.desc1: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.
cobblemon.species.gurdurr.desc2: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.
cobblemon.species.conkeldurr.name: Conkeldurr
cobblemon.species.conkeldurr.desc1: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.
cobblemon.species.conkeldurr.desc2: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.
cobblemon.species.palpitoad.name: Palpitoad
cobblemon.species.palpitoad.desc1: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.
cobblemon.species.palpitoad.desc2: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
cobblemon.species.seismitoad.name: Seismitoad
cobblemon.species.seismitoad.desc1: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.
cobblemon.species.seismitoad.desc2: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.
cobblemon.species.swadloon.name: Swadloon
cobblemon.species.swadloon.desc1: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
cobblemon.species.swadloon.desc2: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
cobblemon.species.leavanny.name: Leavanny
cobblemon.species.leavanny.desc1: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
cobblemon.species.leavanny.desc2: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
cobblemon.species.whirlipede.name: Whirlipede
cobblemon.species.whirlipede.desc1: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
cobblemon.species.whirlipede.desc2: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.
cobblemon.species.scolipede.name: Scolipede
cobblemon.species.scolipede.desc1: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.
cobblemon.species.scolipede.desc2: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.
cobblemon.species.whimsicott.name: Whimsicott
cobblemon.species.whimsicott.desc1: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
cobblemon.species.whimsicott.desc2: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
cobblemon.species.lilligant.name: Lilligant
cobblemon.species.lilligant.desc1: It’s believed that even first-rate gardeners have a hard time getting the flower on a Lilligant’s head to bloom.
cobblemon.species.lilligant.desc2: Essential oils made from Lilligant flowers have a sublime scent, but they’re also staggeringly expensive.
cobblemon.species.krokorok.name: Krokorok
cobblemon.species.krokorok.desc1: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.
cobblemon.species.krokorok.desc2: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
cobblemon.species.krookodile.name: Krookodile
cobblemon.species.krookodile.desc1: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.
cobblemon.species.krookodile.desc2: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.
cobblemon.species.darmanitan.name: Darmanitan
cobblemon.species.darmanitan.desc1: The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon can deliver punches capable of obliterating a dump truck.
cobblemon.species.darmanitan.desc2: This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.crustle.name: Crustle
cobblemon.species.crustle.desc1: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.
cobblemon.species.crustle.desc2: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.
cobblemon.species.scrafty.name: Scrafty
cobblemon.species.scrafty.desc1: As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s concrete pillars.
cobblemon.species.scrafty.desc2: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.
cobblemon.species.cofagrigus.name: Cofagrigus
cobblemon.species.cofagrigus.desc1: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.
cobblemon.species.cofagrigus.desc2: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
cobblemon.species.carracosta.name: Carracosta
cobblemon.species.carracosta.desc1: Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.
cobblemon.species.carracosta.desc2: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.
cobblemon.species.archeops.name: Archeops
cobblemon.species.archeops.desc1: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
cobblemon.species.archeops.desc2: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.
cobblemon.species.garbodor.name: Garbodor
cobblemon.species.garbodor.desc1: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
cobblemon.species.garbodor.desc2: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.
cobblemon.species.zoroark.name: Zoroark
cobblemon.species.zoroark.desc1: This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to keep its den and pack safe.
cobblemon.species.zoroark.desc2: Seeking to ease the burden of their solitude, lonely Trainers tell Zoroark to show illusions to them.
cobblemon.species.cinccino.name: Cinccino
cobblemon.species.cinccino.desc1: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
cobblemon.species.cinccino.desc2: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.
cobblemon.species.gothorita.name: Gothorita
cobblemon.species.gothorita.desc1: It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.
cobblemon.species.gothorita.desc2: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.
cobblemon.species.gothitelle.name: Gothitelle
cobblemon.species.gothitelle.desc1: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.
cobblemon.species.gothitelle.desc2: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.
cobblemon.species.duosion.name: Duosion
cobblemon.species.duosion.desc1: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.
cobblemon.species.duosion.desc2: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.
cobblemon.species.reuniclus.name: Reuniclus
cobblemon.species.reuniclus.desc1: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.
cobblemon.species.reuniclus.desc2: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
cobblemon.species.swanna.name: Swanna
cobblemon.species.swanna.desc1: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
cobblemon.species.swanna.desc2: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
cobblemon.species.vanillish.name: Vanillish
cobblemon.species.vanillish.desc1: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.
cobblemon.species.vanillish.desc2: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.vanilluxe.name: Vanilluxe
cobblemon.species.vanilluxe.desc1: When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.
cobblemon.species.vanilluxe.desc2: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.sawsbuck.name: Sawsbuck
cobblemon.species.sawsbuck.desc1: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.
cobblemon.species.sawsbuck.desc2: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
cobblemon.species.escavalier.name: Escavalier
cobblemon.species.escavalier.desc1: They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.
cobblemon.species.escavalier.desc2: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.
cobblemon.species.amoonguss.name: Amoonguss
cobblemon.species.amoonguss.desc1: This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores aren’t washed off quickly, they’ll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.
cobblemon.species.amoonguss.desc2: Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have been dropped on the ground.
cobblemon.species.jellicent.name: Jellicent
cobblemon.species.jellicent.desc1: Most of this Pokémon’s body composition is identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships its lair.
cobblemon.species.jellicent.desc2: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.
cobblemon.species.galvantula.name: Galvantula
cobblemon.species.galvantula.desc1: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.
cobblemon.species.galvantula.desc2: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.
cobblemon.species.ferrothorn.name: Ferrothorn
cobblemon.species.ferrothorn.desc1: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.
cobblemon.species.ferrothorn.desc2: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.
cobblemon.species.klang.name: Klang
cobblemon.species.klang.desc1: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.
cobblemon.species.klang.desc2: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.
cobblemon.species.klinklang.name: Klinklang
cobblemon.species.klinklang.desc1: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.
cobblemon.species.klinklang.desc2: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.
cobblemon.species.eelektrik.name: Eelektrik
cobblemon.species.eelektrik.desc1: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
cobblemon.species.eelektrik.desc2: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
cobblemon.species.eelektross.name: Eelektross
cobblemon.species.eelektross.desc1: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
cobblemon.species.eelektross.desc2: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
cobblemon.species.beheeyem.name: Beheeyem
cobblemon.species.beheeyem.desc1: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.
cobblemon.species.beheeyem.desc2: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.
cobblemon.species.lampent.name: Lampent
cobblemon.species.lampent.desc1: This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary of death.
cobblemon.species.lampent.desc2: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.
cobblemon.species.chandelure.name: Chandelure
cobblemon.species.chandelure.desc1: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.
cobblemon.species.chandelure.desc2: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.
cobblemon.species.fraxure.name: Fraxure
cobblemon.species.fraxure.desc1: After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its tusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.
cobblemon.species.fraxure.desc2: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.
cobblemon.species.haxorus.name: Haxorus
cobblemon.species.haxorus.desc1: Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its tusks in top condition.
cobblemon.species.haxorus.desc2: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.
cobblemon.species.beartic.name: Beartic
cobblemon.species.beartic.desc1: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.
cobblemon.species.beartic.desc2: It swims energetically through frigid seas. When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater with its breath so it can rest on the ice.
cobblemon.species.accelgor.name: Accelgor
cobblemon.species.accelgor.desc1: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.
cobblemon.species.accelgor.desc2: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.
cobblemon.species.mienshao.name: Mienshao
cobblemon.species.mienshao.desc1: When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.
cobblemon.species.mienshao.desc2: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.
cobblemon.species.golurk.name: Golurk
cobblemon.species.golurk.desc1: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.
cobblemon.species.golurk.desc2: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.
cobblemon.species.bisharp.name: Bisharp
cobblemon.species.bisharp.desc1: It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.
cobblemon.species.bisharp.desc2: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.
cobblemon.species.braviary.name: Braviary
cobblemon.species.braviary.desc1: Known for its bravery and pride, this majestic Pokémon is often seen as a motif for various kinds of emblems.
cobblemon.species.braviary.desc2: Because this Pokémon is hotheaded and belligerent, it’s Corviknight that’s taken the role of transportation in Galar.
cobblemon.species.mandibuzz.name: Mandibuzz
cobblemon.species.mandibuzz.desc1: Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they’re ready to leave the nest.
cobblemon.species.mandibuzz.desc2: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.
cobblemon.species.zweilous.name: Zweilous
cobblemon.species.zweilous.desc1: While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.
cobblemon.species.zweilous.desc2: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.
cobblemon.species.hydreigon.name: Hydreigon
cobblemon.species.hydreigon.desc1: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.
cobblemon.species.hydreigon.desc2: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their target goes down.
cobblemon.species.volcarona.name: Volcarona
cobblemon.species.volcarona.desc1: Volcarona scatters burning scales. Some say it does this to start fires. Others say it’s trying to rescue those that suffer in the cold.
cobblemon.species.volcarona.desc2: This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as a deity of fire.
cobblemon.species.quilladin.name: Quilladin
cobblemon.species.quilladin.desc1: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
cobblemon.species.quilladin.desc2: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.
cobblemon.species.chesnaught.name: Chesnaught
cobblemon.species.chesnaught.desc1: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
cobblemon.species.chesnaught.desc2: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
cobblemon.species.braixen.name: Braixen
cobblemon.species.braixen.desc1: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
cobblemon.species.braixen.desc2: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
cobblemon.species.delphox.name: Delphox
cobblemon.species.delphox.desc1: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
cobblemon.species.delphox.desc2: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
cobblemon.species.frogadier.name: Frogadier
cobblemon.species.frogadier.desc1: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
cobblemon.species.frogadier.desc2: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.
cobblemon.species.greninja.name: Greninja
cobblemon.species.greninja.desc1: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
cobblemon.species.greninja.desc2: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
cobblemon.species.diggersby.name: Diggersby
cobblemon.species.diggersby.desc1: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.
cobblemon.species.diggersby.desc2: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.fletchinder.name: Fletchinder
cobblemon.species.fletchinder.desc1: Fletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.
cobblemon.species.fletchinder.desc2: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.
cobblemon.species.talonflame.name: Talonflame
cobblemon.species.talonflame.desc1: Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.
cobblemon.species.talonflame.desc2: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.
cobblemon.species.spewpa.name: Spewpa
cobblemon.species.spewpa.desc1: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
cobblemon.species.spewpa.desc2: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
cobblemon.species.vivillon.name: Vivillon
cobblemon.species.vivillon.desc1: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
cobblemon.species.vivillon.desc2: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
cobblemon.species.pyroar.name: Pyroar
cobblemon.species.pyroar.desc1: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.
cobblemon.species.pyroar.desc2: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.
cobblemon.species.floette.name: Floette
cobblemon.species.floette.desc1: It raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.
cobblemon.species.floette.desc2: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.
cobblemon.species.florges.name: Florges
cobblemon.species.florges.desc1: It controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.
cobblemon.species.florges.desc2: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.
cobblemon.species.gogoat.name: Gogoat
cobblemon.species.gogoat.desc1: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
cobblemon.species.gogoat.desc2: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
cobblemon.species.pangoro.name: Pangoro
cobblemon.species.pangoro.desc1: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.
cobblemon.species.pangoro.desc2: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.
cobblemon.species.meowstic.name: Meowstic
cobblemon.species.meowstic.desc1: Revealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of its ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally keeps the patterns hidden, however.
cobblemon.species.meowstic.desc2: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.
cobblemon.species.doublade.name: Doublade
cobblemon.species.doublade.desc1: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.
cobblemon.species.doublade.desc2: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.
cobblemon.species.aegislash.name: Aegislash
cobblemon.species.aegislash.desc1: In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.
cobblemon.species.aegislash.desc2: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.
cobblemon.species.aromatisse.name: Aromatisse
cobblemon.species.aromatisse.desc1: The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.
cobblemon.species.aromatisse.desc2: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.
cobblemon.species.slurpuff.name: Slurpuff
cobblemon.species.slurpuff.desc1: By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.
cobblemon.species.slurpuff.desc2: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.
cobblemon.species.malamar.name: Malamar
cobblemon.species.malamar.desc1: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.
cobblemon.species.malamar.desc2: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.
cobblemon.species.barbaracle.name: Barbaracle
cobblemon.species.barbaracle.desc1: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.
cobblemon.species.barbaracle.desc2: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.
cobblemon.species.dragalge.name: Dragalge
cobblemon.species.dragalge.desc1: Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.
cobblemon.species.dragalge.desc2: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.
cobblemon.species.clawitzer.name: Clawitzer
cobblemon.species.clawitzer.desc1: After using the feelers on its oversized claw to detect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches a cannonball of water at its target.
cobblemon.species.clawitzer.desc2: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.
cobblemon.species.heliolisk.name: Heliolisk
cobblemon.species.heliolisk.desc1: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
cobblemon.species.heliolisk.desc2: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.
cobblemon.species.tyrantrum.name: Tyrantrum
cobblemon.species.tyrantrum.desc1: This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.
cobblemon.species.tyrantrum.desc2: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.
cobblemon.species.aurorus.name: Aurorus
cobblemon.species.aurorus.desc1: Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.
cobblemon.species.aurorus.desc2: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.
cobblemon.species.sylveon.name: Sylveon
cobblemon.species.sylveon.desc1: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.
cobblemon.species.sylveon.desc2: There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.sliggoo.name: Sliggoo
cobblemon.species.sliggoo.desc1: Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through anything, so predators steer clear of it.
cobblemon.species.sliggoo.desc2: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.
cobblemon.species.goodra.name: Goodra
cobblemon.species.goodra.desc1: Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.
cobblemon.species.goodra.desc2: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.
cobblemon.species.trevenant.name: Trevenant
cobblemon.species.trevenant.desc1: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.
cobblemon.species.trevenant.desc2: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.
cobblemon.species.gourgeist.name: Gourgeist
cobblemon.species.gourgeist.desc1: Eerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of night. The sounds are said to be the wails of spirits who are suffering in the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.gourgeist.desc2: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.avalugg.name: Avalugg
cobblemon.species.avalugg.desc1: At high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found with clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims among the icebergs.
cobblemon.species.avalugg.desc2: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s body returns to a pristine state overnight.
cobblemon.species.noivern.name: Noivern
cobblemon.species.noivern.desc1: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.
cobblemon.species.noivern.desc2: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
cobblemon.species.dartrix.name: Dartrix
cobblemon.species.dartrix.desc1: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.
cobblemon.species.dartrix.desc2: It never slacks when it comes to the task of cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.
cobblemon.species.decidueye.name: Decidueye
cobblemon.species.decidueye.desc1: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye’s shots never miss.
cobblemon.species.decidueye.desc2: In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an arrow quill, piercing an opponent’s weak point before they notice what’s happening.
cobblemon.species.torracat.name: Torracat
cobblemon.species.torracat.desc1: In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on Torracat’s neck rings like a bell and produces stronger flames than usual.
cobblemon.species.torracat.desc2: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.
cobblemon.species.incineroar.name: Incineroar
cobblemon.species.incineroar.desc1: It excels at violent, no-holds-barred battles. The temperature of the flames that issue from its navel exceeds 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.incineroar.desc2: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.
cobblemon.species.brionne.name: Brionne
cobblemon.species.brionne.desc1: As if dancing, it artfully dodges the attacks of its enemies. All the while, it’s busy forming a bunch of balloons to overwhelm its foes.
cobblemon.species.brionne.desc2: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that’s leading them.
cobblemon.species.primarina.name: Primarina
cobblemon.species.primarina.desc1: With its mouth, it makes sonic waves that sound like beautiful singing. It uses the sonic waves to control its water balloons.
cobblemon.species.primarina.desc2: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.
cobblemon.species.trumbeak.name: Trumbeak
cobblemon.species.trumbeak.desc1: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.
cobblemon.species.trumbeak.desc2: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
cobblemon.species.toucannon.name: Toucannon
cobblemon.species.toucannon.desc1: They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.
cobblemon.species.toucannon.desc2: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
cobblemon.species.gumshoos.name: Gumshoos
cobblemon.species.gumshoos.desc1: Although it wasn’t originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.
cobblemon.species.gumshoos.desc2: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!
cobblemon.species.charjabug.name: Charjabug
cobblemon.species.charjabug.desc1: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
cobblemon.species.charjabug.desc2: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.
cobblemon.species.vikavolt.name: Vikavolt
cobblemon.species.vikavolt.desc1: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.
cobblemon.species.vikavolt.desc2: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.
cobblemon.species.crabominable.name: Crabominable
cobblemon.species.crabominable.desc1: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
cobblemon.species.crabominable.desc2: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.
cobblemon.species.ribombee.name: Ribombee
cobblemon.species.ribombee.desc1: It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.
cobblemon.species.ribombee.desc2: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.
cobblemon.species.lycanroc.name: Lycanroc
cobblemon.species.lycanroc.desc1: This Lycanroc is calm and cautious. The rocks jutting from its mane are razor sharp.
cobblemon.species.lycanroc.desc2: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.
cobblemon.species.toxapex.name: Toxapex
cobblemon.species.toxapex.desc1: To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.
cobblemon.species.toxapex.desc2: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.
cobblemon.species.mudsdale.name: Mudsdale
cobblemon.species.mudsdale.desc1: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs sets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.
cobblemon.species.mudsdale.desc2: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.
cobblemon.species.araquanid.name: Araquanid
cobblemon.species.araquanid.desc1: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.
cobblemon.species.araquanid.desc2: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.
cobblemon.species.lurantis.name: Lurantis
cobblemon.species.lurantis.desc1: This Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower. A properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous, brilliant colors.
cobblemon.species.lurantis.desc2: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.
cobblemon.species.shiinotic.name: Shiinotic
cobblemon.species.shiinotic.desc1: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.
cobblemon.species.shiinotic.desc2: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.
cobblemon.species.salazzle.name: Salazzle
cobblemon.species.salazzle.desc1: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.
cobblemon.species.salazzle.desc2: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.
cobblemon.species.bewear.name: Bewear
cobblemon.species.bewear.desc1: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.
cobblemon.species.bewear.desc2: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.
cobblemon.species.steenee.name: Steenee
cobblemon.species.steenee.desc1: As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.
cobblemon.species.steenee.desc2: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.
cobblemon.species.tsareena.name: Tsareena
cobblemon.species.tsareena.desc1: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.
cobblemon.species.tsareena.desc2: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.
cobblemon.species.golisopod.name: Golisopod
cobblemon.species.golisopod.desc1: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.
cobblemon.species.golisopod.desc2: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.
cobblemon.species.palossand.name: Palossand
cobblemon.species.palossand.desc1: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.
cobblemon.species.palossand.desc2: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.
cobblemon.species.silvally.name: Silvally
cobblemon.species.silvally.desc1: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
cobblemon.species.silvally.desc2: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
cobblemon.species.hakamoo.name: Hakamo-o
cobblemon.species.hakamoo.desc1: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.
cobblemon.species.hakamoo.desc2: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.
cobblemon.species.kommoo.name: Kommo-o
cobblemon.species.kommoo.desc1: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.
cobblemon.species.kommoo.desc2: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.
cobblemon.species.cosmoem.name: Cosmoem
cobblemon.species.cosmoem.desc1: The absorption of starlight fuels this Pokémon’s growth. The shell that encases it is harder than any known material.
cobblemon.species.cosmoem.desc2: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.
cobblemon.species.solgaleo.name: Solgaleo
cobblemon.species.solgaleo.desc1: When light radiates from its body, this Pokémon could almost appear to be the sun. It will dispel any darkness and light up the world.
cobblemon.species.solgaleo.desc2: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.
cobblemon.species.lunala.name: Lunala
cobblemon.species.lunala.desc1: Known as the Beast That Calls the Moon, this Pokémon lives by taking in any and all light and converting it into its own energy.
cobblemon.species.lunala.desc2: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.
cobblemon.species.naganadel.name: Naganadel
cobblemon.species.naganadel.desc1: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
cobblemon.species.naganadel.desc2: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
cobblemon.species.thwackey.name: Thwackey
cobblemon.species.thwackey.desc1: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
cobblemon.species.thwackey.desc2: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.
cobblemon.species.rillaboom.name: Rillaboom
cobblemon.species.rillaboom.desc1: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
cobblemon.species.rillaboom.desc2: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.
cobblemon.species.raboot.name: Raboot
cobblemon.species.raboot.desc1: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
cobblemon.species.raboot.desc2: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.
cobblemon.species.cinderace.name: Cinderace
cobblemon.species.cinderace.desc1: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
cobblemon.species.cinderace.desc2: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
cobblemon.species.drizzile.name: Drizzile
cobblemon.species.drizzile.desc1: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
cobblemon.species.drizzile.desc2: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.
cobblemon.species.inteleon.name: Inteleon
cobblemon.species.inteleon.desc1: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
cobblemon.species.inteleon.desc2: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.
cobblemon.species.greedent.name: Greedent
cobblemon.species.greedent.desc1: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.
cobblemon.species.greedent.desc2: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.
cobblemon.species.corvisquire.name: Corvisquire
cobblemon.species.corvisquire.desc1: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
cobblemon.species.corvisquire.desc2: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.
cobblemon.species.corviknight.name: Corviknight
cobblemon.species.corviknight.desc1: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
cobblemon.species.corviknight.desc2: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region’s airborne taxi service.
cobblemon.species.dottler.name: Dottler
cobblemon.species.dottler.desc1: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
cobblemon.species.dottler.desc2: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.
cobblemon.species.orbeetle.name: Orbeetle
cobblemon.species.orbeetle.desc1: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
cobblemon.species.orbeetle.desc2: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.
cobblemon.species.thievul.name: Thievul
cobblemon.species.thievul.desc1: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
cobblemon.species.thievul.desc2: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.
cobblemon.species.eldegoss.name: Eldegoss
cobblemon.species.eldegoss.desc1: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
cobblemon.species.eldegoss.desc2: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.
cobblemon.species.dubwool.name: Dubwool
cobblemon.species.dubwool.desc1: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
cobblemon.species.dubwool.desc2: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
cobblemon.species.drednaw.name: Drednaw
cobblemon.species.drednaw.desc1: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
cobblemon.species.drednaw.desc2: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.
cobblemon.species.boltund.name: Boltund
cobblemon.species.boltund.desc1: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
cobblemon.species.boltund.desc2: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
cobblemon.species.carkol.name: Carkol
cobblemon.species.carkol.desc1: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.
cobblemon.species.carkol.desc2: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.coalossal.name: Coalossal
cobblemon.species.coalossal.desc1: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.coalossal.desc2: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.
cobblemon.species.flapple.name: Flapple
cobblemon.species.flapple.desc1: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.
cobblemon.species.flapple.desc2: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.
cobblemon.species.appletun.name: Appletun
cobblemon.species.appletun.desc1: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.
cobblemon.species.appletun.desc2: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.
cobblemon.species.sandaconda.name: Sandaconda
cobblemon.species.sandaconda.desc1: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
cobblemon.species.sandaconda.desc2: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.
cobblemon.species.barraskewda.name: Barraskewda
cobblemon.species.barraskewda.desc1: This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
cobblemon.species.barraskewda.desc2: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.
cobblemon.species.grapploct.name: Grapploct
cobblemon.species.grapploct.desc1: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
cobblemon.species.grapploct.desc2: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
cobblemon.species.polteageist.name: Polteageist
cobblemon.species.polteageist.desc1: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
cobblemon.species.polteageist.desc2: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.
cobblemon.species.hattrem.name: Hattrem
cobblemon.species.hattrem.desc1: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
cobblemon.species.hattrem.desc2: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.
cobblemon.species.cursola.name: Cursola
cobblemon.species.cursola.desc1: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.
cobblemon.species.cursola.desc2: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
cobblemon.command.checkspawns.nothing: Nothing can spawn here right now.
cobblemon.ability.adaptability.desc: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.aerilate.desc: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
cobblemon.ability.aftermath.desc: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.
cobblemon.ability.analytic.desc: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
cobblemon.ability.angerpoint.desc: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.anticipation.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.
cobblemon.ability.aromaveil.desc: Protects itself and its allies from attacks that limit their move choices.
cobblemon.ability.asoneglastrier.desc: This Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex's Unnerve Ability and Glastrier's Chilling Neigh Ability.
cobblemon.ability.asonespectrier.desc: This Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex's Unnerve Ability and Spectrier's Grim Neigh Ability.
cobblemon.ability.aurabreak.desc: The effects of 'Aura' Abilities are reversed to lower the power of affected moves.
cobblemon.ability.baddreams.desc: Reduces the HP of sleeping opposing Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.ballfetch.desc: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.
cobblemon.ability.battery.desc: Powers up ally Pokémon's special moves.
cobblemon.ability.battlearmor.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
cobblemon.ability.battlebond.desc: Defeating an opposing Pokémon strengthens the Pokémon's bond with its Trainer, and it becomes Ash-Greninja. Water Shuriken gets more powerful.
cobblemon.ability.beastboost.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.berserk.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.
cobblemon.ability.bigpecks.desc: Protects the Pokémon from Defense-lowering effects.
cobblemon.ability.blaze.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
cobblemon.ability.bulletproof.desc: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.
cobblemon.ability.cheekpouch.desc: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.
cobblemon.ability.chillingneigh.desc: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a chilling neigh, which boosts its Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.chlorophyll.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.
cobblemon.ability.clearbody.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.
cobblemon.ability.colorchange.desc: The Pokémon's type becomes the type of the move used on it.
cobblemon.ability.comatose.desc: It's always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack without waking up.
cobblemon.ability.competitive.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.
cobblemon.ability.compoundeyes.desc: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.
cobblemon.ability.contrary.desc: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.
cobblemon.ability.corrosion.desc: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it's a Steel or Poison type.
cobblemon.ability.cottondown.desc: When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokémon except itself.
cobblemon.ability.curiousmedicine.desc: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it scatters medicine from its shell, which removes all stat changes from allies.
cobblemon.ability.cursedbody.desc: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.cutecharm.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.
cobblemon.ability.damp.desc: Prevents the use of explosive moves, such as Self-Destruct, by dampening its surroundings.
cobblemon.ability.dancer.desc: When another Pokémon uses a dance move, it can use a dance move following it regardless of its Speed.
cobblemon.ability.darkaura.desc: Powers up each Pokémon's Dark-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.dauntlessshield.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.dazzling.desc: Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.
cobblemon.ability.defeatist.desc: Halves the Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.
cobblemon.ability.defiant.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.
cobblemon.ability.deltastream.desc: The Pokémon changes the weather to eliminate all of the Flying type's weaknesses.
cobblemon.ability.desolateland.desc: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.
cobblemon.ability.disguise.desc: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack.
cobblemon.ability.download.desc: Compares an opposing Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat—whichever will be more effective.
cobblemon.ability.drizzle.desc: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.drought.desc: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.dryskin.desc: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.earlybird.desc: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.effectspore.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on its attacker.
cobblemon.ability.electricsurge.desc: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.emergencyexit.desc: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
cobblemon.ability.fairyaura.desc: Powers up each Pokémon's Fairy-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.filter.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
cobblemon.ability.flamebody.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.
cobblemon.ability.flareboost.desc: Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon is burned.
cobblemon.ability.flashfire.desc: Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.
cobblemon.ability.flowergift.desc: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies in harsh sunlight.
cobblemon.ability.flowerveil.desc: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.
cobblemon.ability.fluffy.desc: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.forecast.desc: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.
cobblemon.ability.forewarn.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.
cobblemon.ability.frisk.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.
cobblemon.ability.fullmetalbody.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.
cobblemon.ability.furcoat.desc: Halves the damage from physical moves.
cobblemon.ability.galewings.desc: Gives priority to Flying-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is full.
cobblemon.ability.galvanize.desc: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
cobblemon.ability.gluttony.desc: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.
cobblemon.ability.gooey.desc: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
cobblemon.ability.gorillatactics.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.
cobblemon.ability.grasspelt.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat on Grassy Terrain.
cobblemon.ability.grassysurge.desc: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.grimneigh.desc: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a terrifying neigh, which boosts its Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.ability.gulpmissile.desc: When the Pokémon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack.
cobblemon.ability.guts.desc: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.harvest.desc: May create another Berry after one is used.
